loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is a married man from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines and earns a living by fishing. He has six grown children. Alfredo has been in the fishing business for over 10 years. 

Alfredo wants to improve his fishing business, so he is requesting a loan to buy fishing materials such as fishing nets, lead weights, floaters and other items. With this loan, he will be able to improve his catch which he can then sell at the market.  

In the future, Alfredo would like to expand his fishing business to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, and floaters

loans.name: Mary Anne

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a married woman and mother of three children from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She is sells coconut wine, locally known as tuba, and coconut vinegar. Mary Ann has been selling coconut wine for three years to support her family. Coconut wine is fermented to be made into vinegar.

Mary Ann is in need of additional funds for the expansion of her business and is requesting a loan to buy more coconut wine to resell in the community. The loan will enable her to cater to more customers, thus increasing her sales and income. 

Mary Ann dreams of expanding her business and making it more sustainable and of saving money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wine

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria is a married woman living in the town of  Getafe, Bohol. She has five children. The oldest is 20, while the youngest is 10.

Ma. Victoria engages in a retail business. She sells personal products, such as cologne and apparel, and beauty products, such as whitening lotion and face powder. Aside from retail, she also makes snack foods and sells them to nearby schools to provide additional income.

Ma. Victoria is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients for food-vending and to purchase stocks (such as body spray, soaps, and other beauty products). With this, she will be able to sell more products to her customers and augment her sales and income. In the future, Ma. Victoria would like to expand both her businesses to provide her children with the best.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for food-vending and to purchase stocks (such as body spray, soaps, and other beauty products).

loans.name: Gisselle Maria

texts.es: Gisselle es una joven de 21 años de edad, trabajadora madre de un hijo de 11 meses de nacido a quien le ayuda a cuidar su mama cuando ella se va a estudiar, siendo su meta  culminar su carrera profesional, en la actualidad Gisselle se dedica a la actividad comercial de venta de fritanga y comida variada por las noches, esta es su manera de ganarse la vida, ella busca como salir adelante con su pequeño negocio aumentando el número de platos, es por eso que decide invertir en mas productos, solicita el crédito para comprar carne, granos básicos, queso, verduras y frutas para los diferentes refrescos que realiza, asi ir creciendo economicamente  para garantizar a su hijo un futuro mejor.
texts.en: Gisselle is a 21-year-old young woman, She is the hard-working mother of an 11-month-old son, whom her mother helps take care of  when Giselle goes to study. Her goal is to finish her professional degree. Currently, Gisselle works in the business of selling fried food and assorted food at night. This is her way of earning a living. She is looking to get ahead with her small business by increasing the number of dishes. For this reason she has decided to invest in more products. Gisselle requests this loan to buy meat, bulk grains, cheese, vegetables and fruits for the different soft drinks she makes. In this way she keeps growing economically, which will guarantee a better future for her son.

loans.use: to buy meat, bulk grains, cheese, vegetables and fruit for soft drinks.

loans.name: Andres Eduardo

texts.es:
Andres tiene 21 años de edad es unido tiene un hijo, vive con la mamá con la conviviente y con la hija en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la  Ventanilla Anchoveta se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia puerto Pechiche recinto Anchovetala perteneciente al canton pueblo viejo se dedica a labores agricolas.

Andres se dedica la siembra de maíz y arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos orgánicos e inorganicos.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para los cultivos. 

Las compras las realizará en Ventanas. El sueño es tener dinero para comprar un riego que tanta falta le hace.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas. En el tiempo libre le gusta dormir.

Nota: La ventanilla Bendicion de Dios se desintegro por tal motivo decidio ingresas a la Ventanilla Anchoveta.
texts.en:
Andres is 21 years of age, married, and has one daughter. He lives with his wife and daughter in Ventanas canton, De los Rios province. 

Andres is a farmer and belongs to “Anchoveta” communal bank, located in the parish house of Puerto Pechiche, Anchoveta district, in Pueblo Viejo canton.

Andres grows corn and rice. He is soliciting this loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides, and organic and inorganic manures. With the help of the loan, he will be able to purchase the necessary inputs for his crops.

Andres makes his purchases in Ventanas. His dream is to have the money to buy an irrigation system, the lack of which he feels so greatly.

The challenges he confronts are plant plagues. In his free time he likes to catch up on his sleep.

Note: The “Bendicion de Dios” communal bank has fallen apart and its members have decided to join the “Anchoveta” communal bank.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, herbicides, and organic and inorganic manures for his crops.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 25-year-old, married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as focused. She operates a retail shop, where she sells shoes. Her business is located in an area conducive for the business, and her primary customers are local residents.

She says that her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add to her stock of shoes. Her business goal is to open another shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. She will use the anticipated profits to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to add to her stock of shoes

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 45 years old and married, with five children, two of whom are in school. Rosalina works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalina runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like shampoo, soap, milk, and sugar. She has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, soap, milk, and sugar.

loans.name: Dionalie

texts.en:
Dionalie is married, with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Dionalie is 26 years old and has one child who is in school.

Dionalie has a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional dry goods to sell. Dionalie has been in this business for one year. 

In the future, Dionalie would like to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Ana

texts.en:
Ma. Ana earns a living through her sari-sari (variety store) business. She is a married woman and a mother of three children. 

She sells goods in her store, like powdered milk, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, noodles, and soft drinks. She has been operating her business for almost three years. 
 
Ma. Ana has requested a loan to buy groceries to sell, like canned goods, sugar, milk, coffee, cooking materials, soap, and toiletries. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business in order to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell, like canned goods, sugar, milk, coffee, cooking materials, soap, and toiletries.

loans.name: German Elizardo

texts.es:
Germán, vive con su familia compuesta por su esposa y su hija de 8 años, no posee ayuda del extranjero, para llevar a su hogar lo necesario para que su familia este bien, se dedica a atender su tienda la cual abre a las 6:00 a.m. y la cierra a las 8:00 p.m., hasta la fecha no ha tenido ningún problema en atenderla.
Invertirá en la compra de bebidas azúcar, galletas, pan, jabón, etc. le ayudara a surtir su inventario, mejorar sus ventas y aumentar sus ganancias, espera fortalecer su negocio, atraer más clientes,  cancelar sus deudas y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
Sueña con tener un local más grande para ofrecer mayor variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Germán lives with his family, which is made up of his wife and their 8 year old daughter.  He does not have outside help to provide the basic necessities for his family to live.  He dedicates himself to tending his store that opens at 6:00 am and closes at 8:00 pm.  To this day, he has never missed a day.  

He will use this loan to purchase beverages, sugar, cookies, bread, soap, etc.  This will allow him to stock his inventory, improve his sales, and increase his earnings.  He hopes to strengthen his business, attract more clients, cancel his debts and improve his family's living conditions.  He dreams of having a bigger store that offer a greater variety of products.

loans.use: purchase beverages, sugar, cookies, bread, soap, etc.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is a youth residing in Nairobi's Majengo area. He recently completed high school but hasn't entered college yet. He desires to own a business that will enable him raise funds for his college education and upkeep. 

Albert recently learned about the Fresh Life initiative and thought that investing in a Fresh Life franchise would be a great business opportunity since his area faces huge sanitation challenges. He seeks a loan to help him purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets to be located in his area. 

Albert hopes that the success of this franchise will help him fund his college education and improve the community standard of living by providing better sanitation facilities. He desires to expand his franchise in the future and to inspire more youth to take part in activities that benefit not only themselves but the communities they live in as well.

loans.use: to purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets

loans.name: Narcilita

texts.en:
Narcilita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Narcilita requested a PHP 5,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients, like spices, meat, and vegetables.

Narcilita has been in this business for 37 years now.

In the future, Narcilita would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, like spices, meat, and vegetables.

loans.name: Gynna Patricia

texts.es:
Gynna tiene 34 años de edad es soletera tiene 3 hijos, vive con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provicnia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC ANCHOVETA se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Recinto Anchoveta, Pertenece al Cantón Pueblo Viejo se dedican a Labores Agrícolas.

Gynna se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas abonos organicos e inorganicos y fertilizantes . Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para las siembras. Las compras las realizará en Ventanas.

El sueño es tener dienro para salir de viaje y para comprar un regadio . En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar.
texts.en:
Gynna is thirty-four years old. She is single and has three children. She and her children live in the Ventanas Canton in the Los Ríos Province. 

She is a member of the "Anchoveta" communal bank. It's located in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, Recinto Anchoveta, which belongs to the Pueblo Viejo Canton where the people work in agriculture. 

Gynna works in agriculture; she grows corn, rice, and beans. She is applying for this loan to buy seeds as well as organic and inorganic fertilizers. With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy the necessary supplies for sowing her fields. She will make her purchases in Ventanas.

Her dreams are to have money to travel and buy irrigated land. In her spare time, she enjoys resting.

loans.use: to buy seeds as well as organic and inorganic fertilizers.

loans.name: Manzoor

texts.en:
Manzoor is a 34-year-old married woman; she has been running a business selling milk for the past three years. She has one calf and one cow in milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to allow her to lead a decent life. She is the mother of five children and is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  

Manzoor has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. It’s her third year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through support of Kashf. Now she has requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to purchase one more cow. She hopes to get an increase in her milk production capacity which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Zerina

texts.en:
Zerina is 46 years old, a married woman and the mother of five children. Her husband is a driver by trade and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Zerina has applied for a loan of Rs 40,000 for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and some spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Zerina is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some spare parts for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Halema

texts.en: Halema is a 52-year-old married woman; she has been running a business selling animals for many years. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and sells them near the feast of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; currently she has requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase two more goats. She is in her sixth loan cycle with good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of improving her standard of living through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Here is 36-year-old Betty from Liberia. She lives in Buchanan, Grand Bassa County, which is good at producing fish for the Liberian local market. She is married and she has two children aged 3 and 6, who live at home and attend school. 

Since 1999 Betty has been selling fufu (made from crushed cassava) and palm nut in the local market. She established this business with a small loan from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fufu and palm nut to expand her business, In the future she wants to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fufu and palm nut to expand her business

loans.name: Virgincita

texts.en:
Virgincita runs a sari-sari (convenience store) at her place in Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She has been in this business for more than 30 years. This is the primary source of her income. 

As of this time, Virgincita is in need of additional funds for the expansion of her business. She is asking for a loan to buy additional items to sell in her store such as rice, soda, dry goods, and other snack foods. With this loan, she will be able to cater to more customers, thus increasing her sales and income. 

Virgincita dreams of expanding her business and making it more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her store such as rice, soda, dry goods, and other snack foods

loans.name: Airesty

texts.en:
Airesty is a married woman from Getafe, Bohol, Philippines. She has six children. She operates a sari-sari (convenience) store in which she sells items like eggs, bread, noodles, sugar, cooking oil, and canned goods. 

In addition to operating a convenience store, Airesty maintains a buying and selling business to gain additional income for her family. She buys and sells fish, cassava, and sweet potatoes. Airesty is asking for a loan to buy various fish and additional sweet potatoes and cassava to resell.

In the future, Airesty would like to expand her business to improve her family's standard of living and also to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more fish, sweet potatoes, and cassava to resell.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has seven grown-up children. 

Margarita runs a sari-sari (retail store) business. She sells biscuits, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, canned goods, soaps, and shampoos. She has been operating a retail store for more than ten years. 

Margarita is asking for a loan  to buy various goods, like condiments, beverages and soaps.

In the future, she would like to expand her sari-sari store in order to provide her family with good living conditions and a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy various goods, like condiments, beverages, and soaps.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назира 25-летняя молодая женщина. Она замужем и является матерью троих детей. У нее трое маленьких сыновей в возрасте 9 месяцев, 2 и 3 лет. Назира со своей семьей живет в районе Яван. Ее муж предоставляет услуги мастера по стройке домов, а также имеет 0,60 га участка сада, за которым ухаживает сам. А Назира занимается сельским хозяйством вот уже три года. Она выращивает зерновые культуры и овощи. Сейчас она проводит посев. Для этой цели Назира просит кредит, на сумму которого хочет приобрести качественные семена картофеля и зерна. В будущем за счет продажи с урожая, она хочет провести ремонт в доме и улучшить бытовые условия семьи.
texts.en:
Nazira is a 25 years old woman. She is married and the mother of three children. Her three small sons are 9 months, 2 years and 3 years. Nazira lives in the Yavan region with her family. Her husband is a master carpenter and also owns 0.60 hectares of land which they cultivate themselves.

Nazira has worked with field crop cultivation for three years already. She grows cereals and vegetables. Currently she is sowing. With this aim, Nazira requets a loan, for which she would like to purchase quality potato and corn seeds. In the future, from the sale of the harvest, Nazira would like to carry out repair to her house and improve the living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase quality potato and corn seeds

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es casado, de 39 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos: 2 varones y 1 mujer, el junto a su familia vive en Sololá. Se dedica a la agricultura; esta actividad la heredó de sus padres. Realiza está actividad porque tiene mucha experiencia para hacerlo y  además es la fuente de los ingresos que utiliza para el sostenimiento de su familia. 
Además de la agricultura, el se dedica a la prestación del servicio de transporte en la comunidad donde vive, lo que también le genera otros ingresos que complementan su presupuesto familiar.
El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para la compra de piso cerámico  
El sueño más importante de Juan es la remodelación total de su casa para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is married, 39-years old and has three children- two boys and a girl.  He lives with his family in Sololá.  Juan makes his living in agriculture, which he learned from his parents.  He pursues this line of work because he has a lot of experience in it.  Also, agriculture provides the income he uses to support his family. 
In addition to agriculture, Juan provides transportation services in his community.  That gives him another income to complement his family's finances. 
Juan is requesting a loan of Q 5,000.00 (USD $650) to purchase tile flooring.  
Juan's most important dream is to completely remodel his house to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase tile flooring.

loans.name: Santos Isabel

texts.es:
Santos, se dedica velar por el cuidado de su familia, vive junto a su compañera de vida y una hija, para generar los ingresos necesarios con los que cubre los gastos familiares se dedica a cultivar granos básicos (maíz y frijol), es un oficio que aprendió de su padre y hoy en día lo utiliza para sacar adelante a su familia.
Invertirá en la recolección de la cosecha de maíz y frijol, le facilitara tener de una manera rápida tener la cosecha en su casa para entregar sus pedidos  a sus clientes, espera aumentar sus ganancias, tener más clientes y seguir mejorando su situación económica.
Espera ampliar su área de cultivo para aumentar su cosecha y contar con los ingresos que necesita para cubrir los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Santos watches over his family's city.  He lives with his wife and one daughter.  To generate the income he needs to cover his family's expenses, Santos grows basic grains (corn and beans).  It's a trade that he learned from his father and that he now uses to get his family ahead. 
Santos will invest in harvesting his corn and beans.  The loan will allow him to harvest more quickly, get the harvest to his house and deliver his customers' orders.  He hopes to increase his profit, have more customers and keep improving his financial situation. 
Santos hopes to expand his fields to increase his harvest and count on the income he needs to cover his family's expenses.

loans.use: to harvest his corn and beans.

loans.name: Ana Cesibel

texts.es:
Ana, es una persona hogareña, vive junto a su esposo y sus padres, como apoyo económico para su familia ella se dedica a atender una tienda de productos de para el hogar y una pequeña librería. Lo posee desde hace 10 años y por el momento no ha tenido ningún problema en atenderlo.
Invertirá en la compra de pan, aceite, azúcar, papelería, plumones, tintas, cintas adhesivas, entre otros productos tanto para su tienda como para la librería, espera surtir de productos nuevos su inventario para tener mejor atendidos a sus clientes, aumentar ventas y mejorar las ganancias.
Sueña con tener un negocio mucho más grande y poder tener los recursos para cancelar la deuda.
texts.en:
Ana is a homebody who lives with her husband and her parents.  As a way of helping her family financially, she works tending a shop that sells household products, and a small bookstore.  She has owned the stores for 10 years, and has never had a problem taking care of it.  

She will use the loan to purchase bread, oil, sugar, paper products, markers, ink, and adhesive tape among other things for her home goods store and the bookstore.  She hopes to stock her inventory with new products in order to better serve her customers, increase her sales and improve her earnings.  She dreams of having a bigger business and the resources to cancel her debts.

loans.use: purchase bread, oil, sugar, paper products, markers, inks, adhesive tape

loans.name: Manuel Martin

texts.es:
Manuel es casado, de 49 años de edad, tiene 7 hijos: 2 varones y 5 mujeres, el junto a su familia vive en Sololá. Se dedica a la construcción de casas (albañil) desde hace 25 años, inició este oficio como ayudante y todo el conocimiento lo adquirió de otras personas a las que ayudaba. Esta actividad es la que le genera los recursos económicos que utiliza para el sostenimiento de su familia. 
El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 7,000.00 para la compra de piso cerámico  
El sueño más importante de Manuel es la construcción total de su casa para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel is 49 years old, married, and has seven children (two sons and five daughters).  He lives with his family in Sololá.  Manuel has been working in the house construction business as a bricklayer for 25 years.  He started in this line of work as an assistant and all of the knowledge that he acquired from other people has been a great help.  This business enables him to generate income for sustaining his family.  

Manuel is requesting a loan of 7,000 GTQ so that he can buy ceramic floor materials.  His most important wish is to complete the construction of his house so that he can provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ceramic floor materials.

loans.name: María Karla

texts.es:
María Karla es una microempresaria clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

María tiene 23 años y es soltera. Ella tiene una carrera técnica en Pediatría, por lo que había trabajado en algunas guarderías y como niñera particular durante un año; por las distancias a su hogar decidió dejar estos trabajos y adquirió su papelería, la cual tiene un año y cinco meses abierta. 

En su papelería María ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de artículos necesarios para la escuela u oficina. Pide este préstamo para comprar más mercancía y tener siempre surtida su papelería.

Gracias al esfuerzo puesto en su papelería ha logrado adquirir un celular que necesitaba, contratar una terminal para poder cobrar con tarjeta y en general gozar de estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
María is a micro-entrepreneur who is a client of Kubo Financiero, and here is her story:

María is twenty-three years old and single. She has a technical degree in Pediatrics; therefore, she had worked at several daycare centers and also as a private nanny for one year. Due to the distance from her home, she decided to leave these jobs and acquired her stationery shop. She has had it open for one year and five months.

At her stationery shop, María provides her customers with all types of necessary items for the school or office. She is applying for this loan to buy more merchandise to always have her store stocked. 

Thanks to the effort that she has put into her store, she has managed to buy a cell phone that she needed, rent a credit card terminal to be able to charge credit cards, and enjoy financial stability in general.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her stationery shop.

loans.name: Hipolito

texts.en:
Hipolito is a married man, from the town of Talibon, Bohol. For more than ten years he has farmed seaweed for a living.

Hipolito is applying for a loan with which to buy straw, rope, and more seaweed seedlings. These will enable him to increase his harvest and augment his income.

In the future, Hipolito would like to expand his seaweed farming business, to improve his family's standard of living and to save for his son’s education.

loans.use: to buy straw, rope and more seaweed seedlings

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has three children. 

Rosita has a sari-sari store business, where she sells items, like biscuits, canned goods, noodles, shampoo, soaps, and seasonings. In addition, she has also had a fishing business for 30 years. 

She is requesting a loan to buy items to sell, like biscuits, canned goods, noodles, shampoo, soaps, and seasonings. She hopes to expand her business and improve her profitability, so that she can better support her family, in terms of food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy  items to sell, like biscuits, canned goods, noodles, shampoo, soaps, and seasonings.

loans.name: Vagaspamba  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Vegaspamba está formado por 8 mujeres quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia de Jadan en Cuenca, este lugar tiene un clima frió y hermosos paisajes, su actividad principal es la crianza de animales y la agricultura. Las socias son personas amables, con sentido del humor y muy orgullosas de su cultura que sus padres les han inculcado, también se dedica a la elaboración de sogas, siempre están en la búsqueda de un mejor futuro para sus hijos. 
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Zoila, es una socia activa que se encuentra en el grupo de crédito Vegaspamba desde hace 6 años, en todo este tiempo los créditos le ha ayudado para mejorar su negocio.
La Señora. Zoila tiene 55 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 8 hijos, 6 son mayores de edad, están casados y viven independientes, uno de sus hijos estudia en el colegio y su ultimo hijo de 4 años de edad pasa en casa, su esposo labora en la agricultura y la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña Zoila desde muy joven se dedica a la cría de gallinas, cuyes, cerdos y ganado, cultiva sus terrenos y lo que cosecha es para su consumo y la venta, también se dedica a la realización de sogas lo que aprendió por habilidad. 
El dinero de su crédito es para comprar cabuya y abono para sus potreros. Su meta es de terminar su casa.
texts.en:
The Vegaspamba loan group is made up of 8 women who live around the Jadan en Cuenca parish.  This area has a cold climate and beautiful views.  The main economic activities are animal breeding and agriculture.  The members are friendly people, with a sense of humor and a lot of pride for the culture which their parents have instilled in them.  They also make ropes, and are always searching for a better future for their children.  

One of the members of this group is Zoila.  She is an active member who has been in the Vegaspamba group for 6 years.  In all of this time, the loans have helped her to improve her business.  Zoila is 55 years old, is married, and has 8 children, of which 6 are adults, are married, and live on their own.  One of her children is in high school, and the last son, who is 4 years old stays at home.  Her husband works in agriculture, and they live in a house that they own.  

From a very young age, Zoila has raised chickens, guinea pigs, pigs and cattle and cultivated her own land.  Whatever she grows, is for her own consumption and for sale.  She also makes ropes which she is skilled in.  The money from this loan will be used to purchase cabuya and fertilizer for her pastures.  Her goal is to finish her house.

loans.use: purchase cabuya and fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 56 años, está casada con Orlando quien se dedica a la soldadura.  Sus hijos ya son independientes y viven en la capital. El trabajo de María  consiste en el armado de puertas, ventanas, escaleras de estructura metálica. Tiene un local en el frontis  de  su  vivienda propia. Lleva 08 años en esta actividad económica. Se inicio en este negocio porque su conviviente necesitaba un obrero para pintar las estructuras de las puertas y ventanas. Como no conseguían un ayudante ella se dedico a pintar  y desde entonces decidieron trabajar juntos. Comenta que este rubro le brinda muchas ganancias ya que la ciudad empieza  a crecer y hay más construcciones  y necesitan de sus servicios en el área de carpintería metálica. Cada vez los lugares donde los requieren se hace mas distante a su hogar, por ello cuentan  con una movilidad para transportar sus herramientas de trabajo como su maquina soldadora,  su cortadora de fierro y otros implementos. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.1300, le gusta el grupo que forma parte ya que todos se conocen y siempre están al pendiente de lo que le pueda pasar a los otros. Con el monto solicitado comprará algunos materiales como  fierros, planchas de aluminio y  equipos que le hacen falta para su trabajo de soldadura.
texts.en: María is 56 years old and married to Orlando who works as a welder. Her children are all independent and live in the capital. María's work consists of the reinforcing of doors, windows and metal staircases. She has a storefront at the front of her house. She has been working in this sector for 8 years. She began this job because her partner needed someone to work for him painting the doors and windows he made. Because he was unable to find a helper, she decided to do it herself and, since then, they have worked together. She says that this job makes them a lot of money now that the city is beginning to grow and there are more construction areas that need their metal working services. The locations of the places that need them the most keep getting further from their home and so they need more mobility in order to move their work tools like their welding machine, the bar cutter and other tools. She wants to take this opportunity to ask for $475. She likes the group she is a member of because everyone knows one another and they are always ready to do what they need to in order to help each other out. With the loan, she will purchase materials like metal bars, aluminum sheets and other equipment that they need to do their work.

loans.use: purchase metal, aluminum sheets and other items.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year.

Melinda requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional items to sell, like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, and canned goods. In the future, Melinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, and canned goods

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 31 years old and married. She has two children, one of whom is in school. Melanie works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and has been in this business for one year.

Melanie requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to buy items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, and soap.

In the future, Melanie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, and milk

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 32 years old, married, with eight children. They all live in Buchanan, Grand Bassa County, Liberia. Fishing is an important industry in the town of Buchanan. 

Marie has not been to school but she manages her business well, and she has been involved in this business, selling fish in the local market, for nine years. She learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. She likes her business because it helps her to save money, and her plans are to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business,

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 46 years old, married, with three children between the  ages of 4 and 22 years old, and they all live in Buchanan, Grand Bassa County.  She was unable to attend school, but she is good at managing her home and business. She has been running a table where she sells slippers for the past  ten years. She learned this way of selling from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers for her business. She likes her business because she has many customers. Her plan is to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana, opta por un nuevo crédito para aprovechar estas fechas de fin de año que es cuando tiene mayor demanda de sus clientes comprara lociones, cremas, labiales, blusas, camisas, etc., lo que le dará la facilidad a sus clientes para elegir y comprar.
Con el crédito que se le otorgo antes ha podido fortalecer el negocio, aumentar ventas, tener más clientes satisfechos y mejorar su situación económica, su familia se encuentra saludable y viviendo en mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Juana decided to take out another loan to take advantage of New Year season, which is when there is higher demand from her customers.  She will purchase lotions, creams, lipstick, blouses, tops etc.  This will give her customers more to choose from for their purchases. 
With the loan she was previously granted, Juana has been able to strengthen her business, increase her sales, have more satisfied customers and improve her financial situation.  Her family is healthy and living a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase lotions, creams, lipstick, blouses, tops etc.

loans.name: Wathie

texts.en:
Wathie lives in Logan Town, which is one of the oldest communities in Liberia. Living conditions there are bit difficult due to the high rate of criminals, few bathrooms, filthy conditions, and over-population. But the most interesting part is that rooms are a bit cheaper, there is the option of traveling, it contains one of the biggest markets in Liberia, and there are lower rates for food. 

Wathie is 48 years old. She is married to a local businessman. They have four children who are out of high school. For the past five years now she has been selling charcoal. She started this business with a little amount, which she earned from selling charcoal for her friend. Wathie enjoys the buying from her customers and the money she generates from her business every day. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. She plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Sonia Gricelda

texts.es:
Sonia, ha decidido invertir en la tienda para seguir atendiendo muy bien a sus clientes, comprara golosinas, pan, bebidas, sal, jabón, azúcar, entre otros, con esta inversión su negocio se verá fortalecido y sus clientes aumentaran.
Con el préstamo anterior su negocio se mantuvo fuerte y cumplió con las necesidades de sus clientes, aumentó las ventas, cancelo sus deudas y continúa trabajando para darle a su familia mejor alimentación y cubrir otros compromisos económicos.
texts.en:
Sonia has decided to invest in her store to continue providing excellent customer service.  She will purchase sweets, bread, beverages, salt, soap, sugar and other items.  With this investment, her business will be strengthened and she will earn more customers. 
With the previous loan, Sonia's business stayed strong and she met her customers' needs.  Her sales increased and she paid off her debts.  Sonia will continue working to give her family a better diet and cover other financial obligations.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, bread, beverages, salt, soap, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Wilber

texts.es: El señor Wilder tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero y tiene un hijo que depende de sus ingresos, el cliente se dedica a prestar servicios de transporte como chofer, en  una línea de taxi trufi desde hace 2 años, mientras trabaja deja a su hijo con los padres de su concubina. Actualmente tiene muchas ganas de superarse y solicita un crédito para la compra de muebles y enseres para su hogar, para darle mayor comodidad a su hijo y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Señor Wilber is 26-years old.  He is single and has one dependent son.  He has made his living as a driver offering transportation services with the taxi line Trufi for the last two years.  While he works, Wilber leaves his son with his girlfriend's parents.  Right now, he has a great drive to improve his situation.  Wilber is requesting the loan to purchase furniture and household goods for his home so it will be more comfortable for his son and improve his son's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase furniture and household goods for his home.

loans.name: Mahmarajab

texts.ru: Махмарачаб 54-летний житель района Яван. Он заботливый муж и отец пятерых детей. Махмарачаб пастух. Он вместе со старшим сыном занимается пастушеством. А его жена при дворе дома выращивает мелкорогатый скот для продажи. Махмарачаб помогает жене, куплю и продажу скота он производит сам. Махмарачаб и его семья занимается животноводством более 17 лет. Это их семейный бизнес и прибыль с бизнеса является основным источником дохода семьи. Чтобы увеличить поголовье скота, Махмарачаб обратился за кредитом. Он хочет закупить несколько голов мелкорогатого скота для развития их семейного бизнеса.
texts.en:
Mahmarajab is a 54 years old resident of the Yavan region. He is a loving husband and father of five children. Mahmarajab is a shepherd. Together with his eldest son he works with herding. His wife breeds sheep and goats for selling in the courtyard of their home. Mahmarajab helps his wife with purchasing and selling the livestock. 

Mahmarajab and his family has worked with livestock breeding for more than 17 years. This is their family business and the income from the business is one of the main sources of income for the family. In order to increase the number of cattle, Mahmarajab applied for a loan. He would like to purchase some sheep and goats to expand their family business.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats to develop his family business.

loans.name: Jauh

texts.en:
Jauh is 40 years old and lives in Montserrado County which has the largest Freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with four children between 7 to 21 years old. They are in school and live at home. 

She has been operating a cook shop (restaurant) for the past ten years.  She started this business thorough the help of her husband and she learned this business from her mother. Her favorite part about her business is that every day her food can finish on time, and she makes lots of profit. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase more goods (coal, rice, onion, peppers, and oil) for her business. She appreciates the supporters of BRAC and she promises to payback her loan on time. In the future she wants to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more goods (coal, rice, onion, peppers, and oil) for her business,

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 48 years old and lives in West Point, a very crowded community that is well known in Montserrado County. She is living together with her husband and six children at home. The ages of the children range from 12 years to 28 years, and they are going to school. Her husband is a driver. 

Rebecca sells charcoal and has not encountered any problems with the business. Moreover, the business has being ongoing for the past 3 years and she has been making improvements. She started the business with earnings from her spouse’s salary. She is requesting a loan to buy more charcoal. She hopes to improve her business further by building a bigger food center for the future.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 42 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married, and her husband is a driver. They have four children between 18 and 24, three of whom are in school and live at home. Elizabeth describes herself as a hard-working woman. For the past 10 years she has been running a cook shop (restaurant) where she sells rice and soup in the local market. She likes her business because of the ways customers buy from her. She started this business with money given to her by husband. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice,  pepper,  fish, vita, dry-bush-meat, onions, coal, etc. for her business. Elizabeth plans to buy a piece of land and build a house.  She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies for her business

loans.name: Dorcus

texts.en: Dorcus is 29 years old and is married to a teacher. They have a nine-year-old child, who is attending school. They all live in the capital city (Buchanan) of Grand Bassa County that is good at producing fish for the Liberian local market. For the past two years, Dorcus has been selling palm oil, rice, biscuits, candy, sardines, etc., in the local market. She established this business with a small loan from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, rice, biscuits, candy, sardines, etc., to expand her business. In the near future she wants to build a house for her child.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice, biscuits, candy, sardines, etc., to expand her business,

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 44-year-old married woman. She has six children. She describes herself to be honest and ambitious. She operates a retail shop where she sells groceries. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her family challenge to be lack of access to clean water. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will have a healthy and educated family. This is her sixth loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 40,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 46-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 12 to 23 years. He describes himself to be committed. He operates a butchery where he sells meat.

He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are local consumers. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds to buy more stock of meat to sell in his butchery. He will use the KES 80,000 loan to add stock of meat in his butchery. His business goal is to be able to sell in wholesale within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will create employment and open more butcheries. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 50,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: add stock of meat in his butchery

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew is a married man. He has four children, with ages ranging from four to twelve. He describes himself as committed. He operates a farm where he grows potatoes and other crops. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are business people. He describes his biggest business challenge as poor weather. He will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy fertilizer, seed and other farm inputs to enable him to plant more potatoes. His business goal is to increase his area of cultivation within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to create employment. This is his second loan with SMEP-DTM. A previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, seed and other farm inputs

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.ru: Шавкат жизнерадостный и общительный мужчина в возрасте 30 лет. Он женат и имеет детей. В юности он не смог получит высшее образование и специальность, так как его родители не имели возможности оплачивать его обучение. Поэтому Шавкат начал развивать в себе предпринимательские качества. Он начал пробовать разного вида торговлю и так получал доход. На сегодня он занимается стабильным бизнесом. Он продаёт канцелярские товары. Для этого у него имеется прилавок. Этот бизнес приносит ему хороший доход, что помогает ему жить достойно. Но Шавкат сейчас желает расширить ассортимент своего товара, чтобы иметь больше покупателей для увеличения своей доходности. Но он не имеет достаточной суммы денег, чтобы осуществить закуп. Поэтому Шавкат обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку канцелярских принадлежностей. Он надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Shavkat is a happy and sociable man of the age of 30 years. He is married and has children. In his youth, he was not able to receive higher education and specialization, as his parents did not have the possibility to pay for his education. Therefore, Shavkat started developing his entrepreneurial skills. He started trying different types of sales activities and got an income this way.

Currently Shavkat has a stable business. He sells stationary. He has a stall for this. This business brings him a good income, which helps him live in dignity. Shavkat would currently like to expand his assortment of goods, in order to get more customers and increase his income. He does however not have enough money to carry out the purchase. Therefore he turned to Arvand and wanted to get a loan to purchase stationary. He hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase office supplies

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en: Pablo is a passionate Poblano farmer focused on providing for his family through what they grow. As is typical for small Mexican farmers, margins are tight and he does not turn a large profit. Despite that, the farm represents the family's primary income source and so Pablo is constantly looking to reduce his operating costs while maintaining or improving yields. He is investing in a 30 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove in order to save money, reduce the environmental impact of his farm, and to better use the abundant cow manure available on his farm. The biodigester will treat the animal waste through anaerobic digestion, generating clean-burning, renewable biogas and a potent biofertilizer. Pablo and his family will use the biogas to reduce their reliance on non-renewable propane in the kitchen and for heating bathwater; the biofertilizer will help him improve the soil quality of his terrain without having to spend on expensive, agrochemical fertilizers. Pablo's loan represents 50% of the total cost of his biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.use: buy a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
Ma. Gina is a married woman and a mother of five children in Talibon, Bohol. She has operated a sari-sari or variety store business for more than nine years. She sells various goods and items to the people in her place. Ma. Gina needs a loan for the expansion of her business. 

For this reason, she joined CEVI to apply for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, rice, corn grits, sodas and other beverages, soap and toiletries. With this additional stock, she will be able to attract and cater to more customers in her store. Ma. Gina hopes to expand her store in the future so that it will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, rice, corn grits, sodas and other beverages, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is the mother of three young children. She is engaged in raising hogs as a business. She has been raising pigs for almost six years. Aside from hog raising, she also grows rice to obtain additional income. 

As of now, Juana is asking for a loan to buy pig feed and an additional piglet to raise. With this, she will be able to grow healthy pigs which she can sell in the market. Juana hopes of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and an additional piglet to raise

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a single mother of three young children from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a farming business for five years. This is the source of her income, with which she raises her children and provides for their daily needs. 

Gloria is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, farm labor, and pesticides. Through this assistance, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm thus augmenting her harvest and yield. In the future, Gloria hopes to make her farming business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, farm labor, and pesticides

loans.name: Guilerma

texts.en:
Guilerma works hard to support her family. Guilerma is a widow, and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Guilerma requested a  loan through GDMPC to purchase fishing materials and more fish to sell in her fish stall. Guilerma has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Guilerma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials and more fish to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is engaged in a sari-sari store (convenience store) business in the community of Talibon, Bohol. She is a married woman. 

While her husband is working as a driver, she is busy attending to her customers in her store. 

Elsa would like to expand her inventory by adding more merchandise to her store. Elsa is asking for a loan to buy rice, corn, soft drinks, and snack foods. 

With this loan, Elsa will be able to improve her stocks, thus attracting more buyers in her store.

loans.use: to buy rice, corn, soft drinks, and snack foods.

loans.name: Chamukamuvhu Group

texts.en:
Janet is a mother of two, 25 years old, and the leader of the ladies' group Chamukamuvhu. She has done farming activities on her family plot since 2008 when she was married. She mainly grew maize and some sweet potatoes that have provided the source of food for her family. However, due to inconsistent rainfall patterns over the years, the returns from the fields are dwindling annually. While she would have tried venturing into tobacco farming to get more cash, as other communal farmers are doing, she cannot. She does not have a big plot and will therefore need to embark on intensive farming. She is starting tomato farming and getting a drip irrigation kit will help her manage the water supply she gets from a nearby well. The cash generated from the tomato farming will help provide cash to purchase food for her family as well as help her purchase a variety of seedlings to increase her horticultural farming venture. She hopes to be able to raise money to get her children into school as well as build an additional bedroom for them on her homestead.  

This group comes from Goromonzi, a farming area which is close to Harare, and are venturing into horticulture as it made business sense for them.  The group is made up of members between the ages of 23 and 32, with an average age of 26 years.  After their Start and Improve Your Business (SIYB) Program training, they decided to carry out gardening on a commercial basis.  They have been doing their gardening since July 2013. The group members are mostly orphans and now have families of their own.  From the proceeds of their business they intend to raise an income for their families. They would like to request this loan to install a drip irrigation kit and to buy tomato and onion seedlings for their gardening venture.  The group plans to increase their farming area from 1 hectare to 5 hectares over the next 12 months.  They also want to work and ensure that all the group members have individual irrigation kits on their plots to increase their productivity rates. 

PENYA assists borrowers with entrepreneurial skills training through the Start and Improve Your Business (SIYB) Program.  PENYA also helps them form Village Savings and Loans Associations, where they save proceeds from their businesses that will then become the future sources of additional loans and business investments.  Finally, PENYA carries out mentoring and monitoring visits to ensure that the businesses are being run viably.  Through linkages created with extension workers and some buyers, PENYA borrowers have access to further training in the production and selling of their produce.

loans.use: To install a drip irrigation kit and buy tomato and onion seedlings for their garden

loans.name: Vanamai Mazai Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of women from three families living in the same village. They range in age from 24 to 28 years old. The group members are not employed and have been relying on seasonal casual labor and household farming as a source of income. They came together to start this group so that they could make more money from their farming activities. They are undertaking poultry production as their income-generating project, which is located on one of the member’s homesteads. From the proceeds of their project, they will raise income for their families. They intend to use this loan to purchase day-old chicks, point of lay chickens, stock feeds and feeders as well as to construct a bigger fowl run. From the proceeds of the project, they intend to purchase a drip irrigation kit and also venture into market gardening. The group also plans to increase the number of chicks they rear.  With the introduction of market gardening into their business, they aim to supply the local market as well as food outlets. They also would like to use the proceeds from their business to build additional rooms on their homesteads. 

Eunice (the group leader) is a young woman, age 26, and has two children, a girl and a boy. She currently lives on her own as she is a single mother. Eunice has depended on farming and seasonal causal labor to support her family. With proceeds from this loan, it is her hope that her income will increase and she will save to purchase household assets and build her own house. 

PENYA assists borrowers with entrepreneurial skills training through the Start and Improve Your Business (SIYB) Program. PENYA also helps them form Village Savings and Loans Associations where they save proceeds from their businesses that will then become the future sources of additional loans and business investments. Finally, PENYA carries out mentoring and monitoring visits to ensure that the businesses are being run viably. Through linkages created with extension workers and some buyers, PENYA borrowers have access to further training in the production and selling of their produce.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, chickens, stock feeds, and feeders and to construct a bigger fowl run

loans.name: Halimatu

texts.en: Halimatu is 25 years old and lives in the West Point community, which is a populated area in Montserrado County. She is married with a one year old baby. Her husband is a driver. Over the past 2 years she has been selling palm oil in the local market without facing any serious problems. This business started with a little money she got from a Susu club (local group savings account). She sells everyday, spending 12 hours at her business. In so doing, she is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie is 39 years old and lives in the town of West Point, which is a populated area in Montserrado County. She stopped her education in the 6th grade before starting her business. She is married and has two children, ages 6 and 14 years old, who are attending school and living at home. She has been selling apples in the local market without facing any problems with her business for 7 years now. She started this business with money from her brother. She is requesting a loan to buy more apples to sell. Her plan is to live a happy life with her children, and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more apples to sell

loans.name: Germán

texts.en: Germán, a young dairy farmer from the high plains of Tlaxcala, earns his living from what his animals and land provide. It's not the most profitable field of work and Germán finds himself constantly looking for ways to improve his production process. His 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester will allow him to do exactly that. The digester will convert some of the abundant cow manure produced everyday in his dairy into two valuable resources - renewable energy and biofertilizer. The biogas generated by the digester will allow Germán to reduce the amount his family currently spends on expensive and non-renewable propane to heat bathwater and cook. Germán will use the biofertilizer to improve his soils without having to spend more money on petroleum-based agrochemical fertilizers. The economic savings will improve the farm's business model and the environmental impact of his farm will be mitigated through both the displacement of fossil-fuel based fertilizers and fuel as well as improved treatment of the animal waste produced daily on his farm. This loan represents 46% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.use: purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es: Miguel de 57 años de edad, vive con esposa y su hijo en casa propia, Don Miguel  es un hombre  trabajador, responsable y muy emprendedor desde hace 20 años se dedica a la  crianza y venta de ganado de engorde, adicional a eso también cultiva granos básicos. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes. Ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus productos, ha decidido invertir  en la preparación del terreno donde sea sembrar. Por eso ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de otro buey  para poder trabajar mejor la tierra, Con esto espera obtener resultados favorables y continuar brindando la ayuda económica a su hogar que tanto lo necesita.
texts.en:
Migues is 57 years old. He lives with his wife and their son in his own home. Miguel is a hardworking, responsible, and entrepreneurial man. 

For the past 20 years, he has made a living by raising and selling cattle. He also grows basic grains. He has a very good customer base because he has learned how to win the confidence of his customers. He offers high-quality products and good prices.

He has decided to invest in the preparation of land where he will grow crops. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to purchase another ox so that he can better work the land. With this, he hopes to obtain favorable results and continue providing economic support to his home, which needs it greatly.

loans.use: to purchase a working ox.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos de  58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, su nieta y su yerno, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Santos is 58 years old and live in her own home with her daughter, granddaughter and son-in-law. She owns a store where she sells a variety of basic needs products including beans, milk, eggs, and bread. Santos has had her business for many years and this has given her sales experience so that she can receive higher earnings. 

The store is located at her home, in an area that is highly trafficked. She is well-known by her neighbors in the area and has many customers. Santos keeps the store well-stocked. She would like to grow the business and make a new investment but she needs capital to do so. For this reason she is requesting a loan that will allow her to buy what she needs for her store. She is certain that she will pay back her debt and trusts that it will give her family a higher standard of living.

loans.use: to buy beans, milk, eggs, and bread.

loans.name: Camino A La Excelencia Group

texts.es:
Florencia tiene 61 años de edad y nació en el distrito de Challabamba pues vive en el mismo distrito donde nacio y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, chanchos y gallinas. En esta oportunidad florencia requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.(Las personas que aparecen en la parte inferior de la fotografía pidieron permiso para no estar presentes en la reunión). 

Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Camino a la Excelencia” en la comunidad de Totora (La comunidad de Totora está ubicado en el distrito de Challabamba dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco). Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios  se dedican a la agricultura, a la venta de frutas, a la venta de comida, a la venta de comestibles, al engorde de ganado, a la ganadería, a la crianza de animales menores y otros.
texts.en:
Florencia is 61 years old and was born in the district of Challabamba. She now lives and works in the same district where she was born. She makes a living by raising small animals, like guinea pigs, pigs, and chickens. At this time, she needs a loan to purchase guinea pigs. 

The group members in general are thankful for the opportunity and promise to make their payments at the specified times. (The people who appear in the lower part of the photograph requested permission to miss this meeting).

A group of friends and neighbors formed the "Camino a la Excelencia" communal bank in the Totora community. (The Totora community is located in the Challabamba district, in the Paucartambo province in the department of Cusco.) This communal bank is made up of many people who are always looking for ways to move forward and, with their daily effort, provide a better future for their children. The members make a living in agriculture, fruit sales, food sales, grocery sales, livestock fattening, ranching, raising small animals, and other activities.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs.

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.ru: Бахром добродушный и трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 36 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Вместе со своей семьёй живёт в маленькой деревне. Бахром очень много работает, чтобы кормить свою семью и удовлетворять все имеющиеся нужды своих детей. Он занимается выращиванием сельхозкультуры. Этим бизнесом он занимается вот уже более 9 лет и имеет в этом деле большой опят. Бахром имеет небольшой участок земли, где и выращивает свой урожай, такой как пшеница, лук,и другие овощи. А также чтобы иметь дополнительный доход, он выращивает и продаёт скот. У него имеется несколько голов скота. В ведении бизнеса Бахрому помогает его младший брат а также жена. Сейчас Бахром планирует заняться посевом, и для этого ему необходимо закупить семена. Для этого Бахром обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку семян для посева. Он очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Bahrom is a good-natured and hardworking man of the age of 36 years. He is married and has three children. He lives in a small village together with his family. Bahrom works a lot in order to feed his family and meet all the needs of his children. He works with growing crops. He has been in this business for 9 years already, and has a large experience.

Bahrom has a small plot of land where he grows his crops, such as wheat, onion and other vegetables. He also raises and sells livestock to get an additional income. He has a few heads of livestock. Bahrom's wife and his youngest brother help him manage the business.

Currently Bahrom plans to do the sowing, so he needs to purchase seeds. For this he turned to Arvand and would like to get a loan to purchase seeds for the sowing. He hopes very much for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to purchase seeds.

loans.name: María Edilma

texts.es:
María tiene 59 años de edad, 33 de ellos los ha dedicado a trabajar en el arte de la confección; aprendió de manera empírica, por medio de la observación, pues desde pequeña veía a su madre elaborar diferentes prendas, poco a poco se fue involucrando en el negocio y desde hace 26 años heredó el negocio de la madre, luego de afrontar el doloroso fallecimiento.
Actualmente María confecciona prendas de línea propia como camisas, vestidos, pantalones y otros, trabaja sola todos los días de 8 am a 6 pm y sus principales clientes son familiares, vecinos y amigos.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de insumos textiles al por mayor (telas, hilos, botones, cierres, entre otros), esto le permitirá ofrecer mayor variedad de estilos y colores a sus clientes, satisfaciendo los diversos gustos, así podrá fidelizar a la clientela y mejorará los ingresos que recibe por su labor.
María manifiesta que su único interés es poder darle continuidad a su negocio, prestando el servicio a sus clientes, pues se siente bien con lo que tiene y manifiesta que gracias a su labor nunca le ha faltado nada.
texts.en:
María is 59 years old and has worked for 33 years making clothing.  She learned the trade in a practical way, by means of observation.  From the time she was very young, she watched her mother make different types of clothing.  She eventually became more and more involved in the business, and 26 years ago she inherited the business from her mother, after facing the painful experience of her mother's passing.

Currently María makes her own line of clothing that includes shirts, pants dresses and other items.  She works on her own every day from 8 am to 6 pm, and her main customers are friends, relatives and neighbors.

She will invest the loan proceeds in supplies such as cloth, thread, buttons and zippers.  This will enable her to offer a greater variety of styles and colors to her clients and satisfy their various preferences.  This will help her to gain the loyalty of her customers and to improve her income.  She says that her main priority is to ensure continuity in her business and provide service to her clients, which makes her happy.  She adds that thanks to her hard work, she has always had everything she needs.

loans.use: to buy textile supplies at wholesale, such as cloth, thread, buttons and zippers.

loans.name: Junerick

texts.en:
Junerick is 33 years old and is a single farmer. He has spent five years in the business. 

He would like to use this loan to pay for labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest further in his farm so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en: Natividad is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has two grown children. She has engaged in two businesses for the past 10 years: a sari-sari (convenience) store and a food vending business. Her husband is a tricycle driver. These activities are the sources of her income. At this time, Natividad is asking for a loan to buy more stocks for her store such as noodles, canned goods, candies, soda, soap, and toiletries as well as ingredients for food making such as flour, sugar, milk, and oil. In the future, Natividad hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stocks for her store.

loans.name: Haidee

texts.en:
Haidee is 65 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Haidee has a fishing business in the Philippines. Haidee requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Haidee has been in this business for thirty years. In the future, Haidee would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Pinky

texts.en:
As the married mother of three children, Pinky works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from frozen foods. Pinky is borrowing PHP 4,500 through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

Pinky has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Nhanh

texts.en:
Nhanh, 56 years old, is married and has three sons and one daughter. She and her husband support the family through the income they earn by sewing clothes. They began this business 20 years ago. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Nhanh intends to take a loan to increase her working capital to buy a new sewing machine. The additional capital will enable her to increase her production and sales. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly, and that this will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine to increase her production of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Enkhchimeg

texts.en: Enkhchimeg, 37 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband renders taxi service to local people. Using her previous loan, she launched her household appliance sales business two years ago. Before running her own business, she had worked as an accountant for 10 years. Now she is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy goods from China at wholesale prices. During this time of year, demand for household appliances increases due to the new year holiday so she wants to continue to sell goods without worrying about inventory shortage. The borrower is a very hard-working individual who strives for better future.

loans.use: to buy household appliances in large amounts

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 63 años, es viuda y vive en su casa propia. Sus hijos ya son independientes y viven en otras ciudades con sus respectivas familias. El trabajo de María consiste en  la confección y venta de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños. Realiza esta actividad en un local en el interior de su vivienda propia. Lleva 08 años en esta actividad. Comenta que se  inicio en esta actividad desde muy joven, porque siempre le gustó diseñar  y confeccionar. Su mamá la motivo para que se dedique a este trabajo. Realiza esta actividad económica junto a unas amigas con quienes ha formado una sociedad. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable porque las empresas solicitan sus servicios para que hagan los uniformes de sus obreros, también lleva a vender sus confecciones al mercado de la ciudad. Su esposo la apoyaba en todo lo que hacia, trabajaban juntos pero ahora trabaja sola, esta aprendiendo a salir adelante sola. Comenta que no se va dejar vencer por la tristeza y seguirá adelante con los planes que ha trazado. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.1300, se siente muy agradecida con la institución por darle la oportunidad de pertenecer aun grupo donde se apoyan mutuamente. Esto le motiva seguir siendo puntual en sus cuotas por pagar. Con el monto solicitado comprará materiales como telas, blondas, elásticos, hilos para seguir confeccionando  y produciendo ya que tiene muchos pedidos.
texts.en:
Maria, 63 years old, is a widow and lives in her own home. Her children are grown up and live in other cities with their families. Maria's work consists of sewing and selling clothing for men, women, and children. She does this work out of her home and has eight years of experience. She says she started sewing very young, because she's always liked to design and make things. Her mother encouraged her to stay with her work. She and some friends now do the work together in a society. 

Her business is rather profitable because businesses hire her to make their workers' uniforms. In addition, she sells her creations in the city market. Her husband used to help her in everything she did. They worked together, but now she works alone, and she's learning to get ahead by herself.  She said that she's not going to let her sadness get the better of her, but rather will continue ahead with the plans that she made.

At this time, she is requesting S/.1300. She is very grateful to the institution for giving her the opportunity to belong to a group in which everyone supports each other. This helps motivate her to make her payments on time. With the loan amount, she will buy materials such as fabrics, lace, elastics, and thread so that she can keep sewing and keep fulfilling the many orders she has right now.

loans.use: buy materials for her sewing business

loans.name: Adriano

texts.es:
Adriano tiene 56 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido, su población se dedica a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de frutales, cafeto y arroz, comercio de los mismo y ganadería, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicios como obrero en construcción civil, realizando las actividades de encofrados, columnas, pisos, los trabajos los realiza en el distrito de Pucara y caseríos aledaños, cuenta con más de 4 años dedicándose a este rubro.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de herramientas y de esta manera tener poder realizar de una mejor manera su trabajo, así como atendiendo la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en: Adriano is 56 years old and lives with his wife in the district of Pucará, a community characterized by its warm climate. The local people work mostly in agriculture, principally cultivating and selling fruits, coffee and rice, and also raising livestock. This community is located two hours from the city of Jáen, which is in the region of Cajamarca in the mountains of northern Peru. Adriano has a construction business. He builds frames for houses and installs floors. He does his work in Pucará and in neighboring areas. He has more than four years of experience in this trade. He is seeking a loan of 500 nuevos soles in order to purchase tools so that he can perform his work more effectively and thus be able to meet his clients' demands.

loans.use: to purchase tools for construction work.

loans.name: Julia Saturnina

texts.es: La señora Julia es comerciante vende refrescos en las calles aledañas del mayoreo el bisne, su negocio lo empezo con ahorro , es una señora sola, a salido adelante ,vende de lunes a domingo desde las ocho de la mañana a doce del día,   su financiamiento lo solicita para invertirlo en su negocio para mantener materia prima ya que con dinero ella compra al por mayor y aprovecha descuentos.
texts.en: Julia sells beverages in the local streets of El Bisne. She started her business with her savings. She is single and gets by selling from Monday to Sunday from 8 a.m. until noon. She has applied for a loan to buy supplies for her business since, with funding, she can buy at wholesale and take advantage of discounts.

loans.use: to buy buckets, sugar, milk, and fruit.

loans.name: Regino Francisco

texts.es: El señor Regino Francisco se dedica a la actividad de prestar servicios en su triciclo desde hace 7 años, es padre de dos niños que estan estudiando, se esfuerza dia a dia para llevar el sustento a su hogar, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa quien tambien tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa, el señor Regino labora de lunes a domingo desde las siete de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde, solicita financiamiento para realizarle mejoras a su triciclo y brindarle mejores condiciones a sus clientes
texts.en:
