Morena sees an opportunity to invest in the purchase of fish, shrimp and shellfish that will help her to vary her business, satisfy her clients' needs, and increase her sales. 

With her previous loan, Morena increased her merchandise which allowed her to better attend her clients, increase her sales, improve her finances, and provide her family with better food, health, and clothing.

loans.use: compra de pescado, conchas, camarones, entre

loans.name: Jentrix's Group

texts.en:
Jentrix is a member of this group in Webuye District.  She is pictured here in a group of eight One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 85 individuals One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Jentrix has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative, and she is standing on the right with her hand raised. She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.

Jentrix is 50 years old and has been a farmer for 25 years. Jentrix works as a farmer to provide for her 11 children. The community and other farmers know Jentrix as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy and an experienced farmer. Other than farming, she is also involved in her community activities such as the women's group, savings group, prayer group and burial committee. Jentrix described her harvest last year as excellent but hopes she can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group. 

The 2013 Long Rains season won’t be Jentrix’s first season with One Acre Fund. She first joined One Acre Fund in 2012 and has continued working with One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and earn enough to feed her family and send her children to school.  As an active member in her community, Jentrix also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she likes leading as well as wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. Jentrix plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school, repair the home, save for the future, buy a cow and invest in a business. Her life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because she has more profits from harvest, more farm training, more farm group support, and the ability to save money and feed the family. 

Jentrix's group needs a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

Please note that there are 3 additional group leaders in this photo that will be working with One Acre Fund but will not be a part of this Kiva group loan. The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Peter's Group

texts.en:
Peter's group consists of 4 group leader farmers in Webuye District. Peter has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 46 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.

Peter is a reliable member of the community.  He is married with 3 children.  Peter is 41 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 20 years to support his family.  In addition to this, Peter is very active in his community and is involved in the men's group, savings group, prayer group, and burial committee.  He described his harvest last year as good.  He hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund in order to continue enjoying the success he is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages. 

Peter joined One Acre Fund in 2011, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Peter joined One Acre Fund so that he could get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, earn enough to feed his family, and send his children to school.  Because he likes being a leader, he wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. Peter has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative.  Working with One Acre Fund has improved Peter's life because he has more profits from harvest, more farm training, more farm group support, and is able to save money and feed the family.  In the future, Peter hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send children to school, repair the home, save for the future, buy a cow and invest in a business.   

One Acre Fund focuses on working with small-holder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Peter and his group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues to provide training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.

loans.use: to allow farmers the opportunity to buy cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Boniface's Group

texts.en:
Boniface's group consists of four group leader farmers in Chwele District with Boniface selected as the Kiva representative. Boniface has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 46 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.
							
Boniface is married and has seven children. He is 49 years old and is known as friendly and active in his community groups such as the prayer group.  Boniface has been a farmer for 25 years and he described his harvest as good last year, but he believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.
  							
Boniface first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2010 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Boniface joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, fertilizer and hybrid seeds and to earn enough to feed his family. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he wants to help more farmers in his community. Boniface plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and buy a cow. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Boniface’s own life was improved because he was able to feed the family.
  							
One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Boniface and her group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Helma's Group

texts.en:
Helma's Group in Busia District. She is pictured here in a group of 10 One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 82 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Helma has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised. She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.

Helma is a reliable member of the community. She is married and has 5 children. Helma is 48 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 20 years to support her family. In addition to this, Helma is very active in her community and is involved in the women's group and burial committee. She hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and to continue the success she is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.

Helma is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader. Helma joined One Acre Fund so that she could get the best seed prices and get new farming methods. She likes being a leader and is an active community member who wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. Helma has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative. In the future, Helma hopes that her profits from 2014 can be used to send her children to school and invest in a business.

Helma's Group needs a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers' harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Hermeregildo

texts.es: Hermeregildo, tiene 55 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa en una aldea del municipio de las vegas, Santa Bárbara, cerca del sector Peña Blanca. Hace 12 años se dedica a la cría y destazo de cerdos para vender. El siempre se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde cuando ayudaba a su padre. Actualmente solicita el quinto ciclo de préstamo y es por 15,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar un lote de cerdos para engorde y venta y también comprar el concentrado para alimentarlos y que crezcan bien. Su propósito es aumentar la producción para tener mejores ingresos y poder ampliar el área de la porqueriza.
texts.en:
Hermeregildo is 55 years old and lives in a common law marriage with his wife in a village in Las Vegas, Santa Bárbara by Peña Blanca. For 12 years he has worked in the breeding and butchering of pigs for resale. He has always worked at this business since the time he helped his father. 

He currently seeks his fifth loan cycle which is for 15,000 Lempiras ($750).  With this he will purchase a lot of pigs for fattening and resale.  He will also purchase concentrated feed so that they will fatten well. Hermeregildo's purpose is to increase production in order to have better income and to expand the size of his pig farm.

loans.use: to purchase a lot of pigs for fattening (and concentrated feed) for resale.

loans.name: Aldarbat

texts.en:
Aldarbat, 29 years old, lives with his wife in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been creating and selling Mongolian traditional boots to local people since the age of 16. He learned the art of boot making from his father who also runs a boot sales business. Aldarbat's wife is a saleswoman at the furniture section of the trade center. 

Aldarbat is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy boot making materials such as felt, rubber and a sewing machine. He is planning to make boots in a large amount as preparation for the upcoming national holiday  known as White Moon. During this particular holiday, demand for Mongolian traditional boots increases, opening up the opportunity to generate greater revenue.

loans.use: to buy boot making materials.

loans.name: Battur

texts.en:
Mr. Battur, 25 years old, lives with his wife and two daughters in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

He has been making and selling yogurt to local people since 2011 with his parents. Now he wants to open his own yogurt factory, as he knows everything relating to the yogurt business. 

He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy yogurt packaging equipment as well as raw materials such as milk, fruit, and sugar. 

Running his own yogurt factory sure will help his family, as his two daughters are growing bigger each passing day. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy yogurt factory equipment as well as raw materials

loans.name: Norma Elizabeth

texts.es: Norma de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica venta de frutas y verduras tomates, cebollas, chiles, papas, zanahorias, pepinos,  entre otros tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el lugar donde comercia es muy estratégico para la actividad y además muy concurrido de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefieren porque su producto es fresco, a buen precio, de calidad y con un excelente servicio; Norma es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre está buscando alternativas que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar frutas y verduras por mayor. tiene buenas referencias de pago, esta agradecida con el apoyo y asegura que podrá saldar la deuda, a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en: Norma, 39 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and two children. She is dedicated to selling fruits and vegetables (onions, chilies, potatoes, carrots, pepino peppers, and others. She has many years of experience selling that has allowed her to increase her earnings. The place where she sells is very busy with people. She has many clients that prefer her because of her fresh products at a good value, with great quality and excellent service. Norma is an entrepreneurial woman who is eager to succeed. She is always looking for new ways to increase her success. In the past few weeks, the demand for her products has increased and she wants to make a new investment, but she does not have enough capital to support new products. Thus, she solicits a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy wholesale fruits and vegetables. She has great references for repayment, is thankful for the support, and assures that she will pay off the loan. She is confident that this will give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Claudia Carolina

texts.es:
La joven Claudia Carolina de 27  años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos,   vive con sus  padres  en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace 03  años al negocio de venta de abarrotería en su negocio ubicado en un  barrio de Nacaome, valle  al sur de Honduras.
Claudia Carolina en su negocio vende todo lo relacionado a la canasta familiar, es una mujer trabajadora y muy emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante,  vende de todo y gracias a su actividad ha podido salir adelante en sus estudios ya que va a la universidad. 
Claudia Carolina está solicitando el préstamo para compra de frescos, agua, café, pan, jugos, azúcar, frijoles, manteca, embutidos y carnes. Con el apoyo del crédito espera mejorar sus ingresos y su negocio,  está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma. 
Claudia Carolina su sueño es terminar su carrera. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Claudia Carolina is a 27-year-old young woman. She is single, does not have children, and lives with her parents in their house. For three years, she has worked in the grocery-sales business in her shop located in the community of Nacaome, in the department of Valle, in the southern part of Honduras. 

In her shop, Claudia Carolina sells all the household staples. She is a hardworking and enterprising woman with a desire to get ahead. She sells a little of everything; thanks to this business, she has been able to continue with her education, as she is a university student.

Claudia Carolina is requesting a loan to purchase soft drinks, water, coffee, bread, juice, sugar, beans, shortening, cold cuts, and meats. With the support of this loan, she hopes to improve her income and her business. She is very happy to continue working with Prisma.

Claudia Carolina's dream is to earn her degree. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November, 2013.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, water, coffee, bread, juice, sugar, beans, shortening, cold cuts, and meats for her business.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty, de 50 años de edad, es viuda, y todos sus hijos ya tienen familia, pero la visitan constantemente, vive en compañía de su sobrino y tiene su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Betty es la costura, oficio que aprendió estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional, e iniciando como independiente con una maquina de coser que compró con su propio capital e instalándolo en su propia casa hace 12 años, realizando ella sola trabajos pequeños a sus vecinos y amistades, fue ganando más clientes a base de su buen trabajo. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el contar con un ingreso económico que le permite solventar sus gastos personales y de su hogar ya que se encuentra sola, además de dedicarse a un oficio que le gusta, le permite distraerse y estar ocupada, se siente a gusto y cómoda realizando este oficio, ha tenido buenas ganancias gracias a la buena  clientela que tiene, por eso tiene planes de instalar un taller de confesiones en su casa. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.1500, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, se compromete a ser puntal con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará una maquina de costura, además de telas e hilos para costura.
texts.en:
Betty, 50 years old, is a widow, and all her children have their own families now, though they visit constantly. She lives with her nephew and has her own house. Betty works by sewing, work she learned at a job training center. She started an independent business with just one sewing machine that she bought with her own capital and a single room of her house twelve years ago. She started alone with small jobs from her neighbors and friends, but gained more customers over time because of her good work. What she likes about this line of work is being able to count on a source of income that lets her meet her personal and household expenses, now that she is by herself. She also likes the work itself, as it distracts her and keeps her busy. She is happy and comfortable with her work and earns good money, thanks to her customers. Because of all this, she has plans to make an entire sewing shop in her home.

For this opportunity, she is requesting a loan of S/.1500 so that she can continue with her goals. For her part, she promises to be timely in her payments. With the amount requested, she will purchase a sewing machine and some more fabric and thread.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine, as well as fabric and thread.

loans.name: Mario De La Cruz

texts.es: Don Mario  lucha a diario con su esposa, ellos se dedican a vender productos químicos como ambientadores  y  chatarras, los cuales compra y vende a un mejor precio, sus hijos también realizan este oficio de manera independiente. Don Mario ha venido mejorando las condiciones de su hogar poniendo inodoro en lo interno de su casa con el apoyo de financiamiento, ahora solicita este crédito para la instalación de un servicio higiénico en la parte de afuera ya que utilizan una letrina y sus deseos es ir mejorando para que su familia goce de buena higiene en el hogar, con el préstamo comprara los materiales como cemento, arena, hierro, bloques, inodoro y tuberías.
texts.en:
Mario works hard everyday alongside his wife. They earn a living by selling products such as air-fresheners and scrap metal, which they buy and then sell at a better price. Their children also do the same work on their own. Mario has gradually improved his living conditions by putting a toilet inside his home thanks to financial support. 

He is now requesting this loan to install a bathroom on the outer part of the house where they are still using a latrine. Mario wishes to continue improving the house so that his family can enjoy the benefits of good hygiene. He will use the loan to buy materials such as cement, sand, re-bar, cinder blocks, a toilet, and piping.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cement, sand, re-bar, cinder blocks, a toilet, and piping.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 36-year-old married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows which produce milk for her to sell. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a conducive environment and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy animal feed. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en: Silas is a 25-year-old married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be creative and focused. He operates a carpentry shop where he makes chairs, tables and other items. His business is located in a marketable place and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy timber, nails and other items for making furniture. His business goal is to own a bigger carpentry shop within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy timber, nails and other items for making furniture.

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en: Onesmus is a 44-year-old married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a butchery shop where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a conducive environment and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of meat. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add stock of meat.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
lucy is a 33-year-old married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be determined and loyal to customers. 

She operates a grocery store where she sells cereals and vegetables; she has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a profitable place, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. 

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to add a stock of cereals and vegetables. 

Her business goal is to have a well established business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will open several outlets of her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add a stock of cereals and vegetables

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 29-year-old married woman; she has 3 children. She describes herself to be honest. 

She operates a retail shop where she sells bread, wheat flour, sugar, and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a convenient place, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add a stock of sugar, bread, wheat flour, and other items she sells. 

Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. 

This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add a stock of sugar, bread, wheat flour, and other items

loans.name: Scholastica

texts.en:
Scholastica is a married woman. She has three children. She operates a farm where she rears poultry for sale. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a convenient place and her primary customers are restaurant owners. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add to her stock of chickens. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. She will use the anticipated profits to feed her family.

loans.use: add to her stock of chickens

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 44-year-old single woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 17 to 26 years. She describes herself to be patient and cooperative. 

She operates a green grocery shop where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a secure place and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add more stock of vegetables and fruits. Her business goal is to improve and maintain her business within five years. She hopes that in the future she will expand her business and make more profits.

loans.use: add stock of vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling personal products in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF in order to buy more items like perfume, body lotion and shampoo to offer for sale.

Analyn successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Analyn's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like perfume, body lotion and shampoo.

loans.name: Ulugbek

texts.ru: Улугбек трудолюбивый человек. Ему 21 лет. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Улугбек в 2013 году поступил в Таджикский педагогический Университет. Улугбек учится по специальности Математика и информатика. Улугбек с детства мечтал стать педагогом. Он учится упорно для того, чтобы получить хорошее образование и дать своим ученикам хорошее знание. Улугбек запрашивает займ на сумму 775 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Ulugbek is a hard working person. He is 2. He is single and lives with his parents. In 2013, Ulugbek was accepted into the Tadzhik Pedagogical University. Ulugbek majors in mathematics and informatics. Ulugbek has dreamed of becoming a teacher since he was a child.  He studies hard so that he can receive a good education and give his students knowledge. Ulugbek is asking for $775 US to pay tuition. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: pay tuition

loans.name: Shukrullo

texts.ru: Шукрулло умный и интеллигентный молодой человек. Он родился в 1987 году. Шукрулло уже более 5 лет работает в средней школе. Он является одним из лучших учителей и всегда старается расширить свой кругозор. Шукрулло имеет средне - специальное образование и поэтому он хочет получить высшее педагогическое образование. Шукрулло с такой целью поступил в Педагогический университет. Он учится заочно и параллельно работает. Шукрулло запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Shukrullo is a smart, intelligent young man. He was born in 1987. Shukrullo has been working in a high school for more than five years already. He is one of the best teachers and is always trying to expand his students' horizons. Shukrullo has vocational degree in education, and he wants to get a degree in teaching. Therefore, Shukrullo entered the Pedagogical University. He studies through distance learning and works at the same time. Shukrullo is requesting a loan of $1,500 to pay tuition. He's waiting for your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: pay tuition

loans.name: Zilola

texts.ru: Зилола является такой женщиной, которая посвятила всю свою жизнь воспитанием детей. Ей 34 года. Она разведена и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Детям 14,13 и 11 лет. Зилола сама обеспечивает своих детей. Зилола опытная портниха. Она 5 лет назад открыла свой швейный цех. Зилола имеет 10 учениц. Она шьёт как национальные платья, так и европейские платья. Зилола хочет увеличить свой оборотный капитал. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки новой швейной машинки и тканей. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Zilola is a woman who devoted her life to raising her children. She is 34. She is divorced and is raising three children. Her children are 14,13 and 11 years old. Zilola provides for her children by herself. Zilola is an experienced dressmaker. Five years ago she opened a sewing shop. Zilola has ten apprentices.  She sews  both traditional and European dresses. Zilola wants to increase her working capital. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 TJS to buy a new sewing machine and fabric. She is waiting for your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: renovate her sewing workshop

loans.name: Khusen

texts.ru: Хусен жизнерадостный и позитивный парень в возрасте 29 лет. Хусен обратился  в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит на покупку скот. Он с малых лет занимается животноводством. Хусен женат и имеет двоих детей. Живёт он со своей семьёй в сельской местности и поэтому имеет опыт в таком виде бизнеса и знает все тонкости этой деятельности. Сейчас Хусен имеет несколько голов скота, которых скоро уже надо будет продавать и получать от этого прибыль. Но пока это не произойдёт Хусен хочет закупить ещё несколько голов скота, которых начнёт уже выращивать и откармливать для дальнейшей продажи. Но сейчас у него не имеется нужной суммы для покупки. Поэтому Хусен обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Он заранее выражает свою благодарность за финансовую поддержку и очень надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en: Khusen is a cheerful, positive, 29-year-old man. Khusen applied for a loan from Arvand to buy livestock He has worked with livestock from an early age. Khusen is married and has two children. He lives with his family in the countryside and therefore has experience in this kind of business and knows all about it. Now Khusen has several head of cattle, which will soon have need to sell for a profit. But until that happens, Khusen wants to buy a few head of cattle, which he would like to grow and fatten for sale. But now he does not have enough money to buy them. Khusen therefore approached Arvand and wants to get a loan to buy the cattle. He is expressing his gratitude for the financial support in advance and hopes for a positive outcome.

loans.use: purchase livestock

loans.name: Huikap Awang Leikai Women Shg Group

texts.en:
This group of seven women is best known as Huikap Awang Leikai Women SHG group. They came together to stand united for one another and formed this group. They belong to a non-tribal community, and are living here in Manipur state on the outskirts of Imphal East district, located in the northeastern part of India. 

The woman pictured with a raised hand is called Thoithoi and is the profile representative of the group. She still shares the same kitchen with her in-laws, but did not get any financial support. Her husband is a seasonal farmer. In the off-season, usually, sand sieving is his way of earning income for the family. 

In order to supplement their income, Thoithoi started her line of weaving activities. She uses a handloom to weave. (A sample handloom can be seen in the picture behind the members.) With her first loan, Thoithoi was able to increase her production as compared to before the loan. The cloth that she weaves includes bed covers, wrap-around skirts, and cloth usable for towels and shawls. She supplies her products at the market at reasonable rates. 

She is happy that she is in good health to support the family income. With the profit that she earns, she usually puts aside some amount to deposit in the group savings on a weekly basis. In this way, every time she gets a loan, she has been able to increase her production. She has been saving most of her profits, as well as her husband's income, for a separate home very soon. 

She has been doing this weaving activity for the past four years now. Now she needs another loan to continue to do better with her business. She will buy materials required, such as yarn of various colours and textures, to weave wrap-around skirts, shawls, bed covers, etc. She also means to buy the finished products from other weavers to supply at the market for a profit. 

Likewise, the rest of the group members are also making steady improvement like her with their respective income-generating activities. All the members in the group are weavers. Thoithoi says, “Thank you so much, Kiva.

loans.use: to buy stocks of yarns in different colours and textures for weaving, and to buy finished products from other weavers to sell.

loans.name: Guillermo León

texts.es:
Guillermo vive en un barrio popular del centro de la ciudad, que se ha visto afectado por la ola de violencia ocasionada por enfrentamientos entre bandas criminales; sin embargo, cada día desde las primeras horas de la mañana el sale a trabajar en su propio negocio, un puesto de venta de fritos que inició hace varios años como una alternativa para generar ingresos que le permitieran solventar los gastos básicos de su hogar; allí ofrece mecato, café y alimentos fritos como empanadas, pasteles, tortas de carne, buñuelos, jugos y gaseosas, entre otros; esto le genera los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento diario a su familia.
El crédito que solicita lo toma como un apoyo para fortalecer su negocio y mejorar la imagen del mismo, pues con el dinero comprará una vitrina calentadora e insumos al por mayor (verduras, pollo, carne, salsas, café, gaseosas, entre otros), así podrá cambiar la vitrina deteriorada que tiene y atraer nuevos clientes para ofrecerles una variedad de productos para satisfacer los gustos de los comensales, logrando obtener un mayor nivel de ventas y mejores ingresos.
Guillermo manifiesta que su edad no le impide seguir luchando para lograr sus objetivos, por ello cada día trabaja con más dedicación y empeño para poder cumplir el sueño de montar su negocio en un local propio, mejorando las condiciones de trabajo y generando una mayor rentabilidad para ofrecer bienestar y mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Guillermo lives in a popular neighborhood in the middle of the city, which has found itself affected by the wave of violence caused by confrontations between gangs. Nevertheless, he gets up in the early hours every morning and goes to work at his own business, a stand where he sells fried foods. He started this some years ago as an alternative means of earning money to meet his household expenses. At his stand, he sells cakes, coffee, fried foods such as empanadas, pastries, meat pies, and donuts,  juices, sodas and more. This business earns him enough money to meet his family's daily needs.

The credit he is requesting will be used to strengthen his business and improve its image. With the money, he will buy a new warming glass case and replace the deteriorating one that he has now. He will also buy various supplies at wholesale, including vegetables, chicken, beef, sauces, coffee, soda and more.  This will help him attract new customer and offer them a variety of products that will suit the tastes of the workers, which all means more sales and more income.   Guillermo says that his age doesn't stop him from continuing to fight to meet his goals. He takes every day with more dedication and drive so that he can achieve his dream of opening a business in its own location, improving his working conditions and earning greater profits, all with the goal of improving the well being and living conditions of his family.

loans.use: buy a glass warming case and food supplies.

loans.name: Milagro Del Socorro

texts.es:
Milagro, se decidió por otro crédito para adquirir materia prima para su negocio de pupuseria, venta de tostadas, pupusas y comida, en esta oportunidad comprará harina, plátano, verduras, variedad de bebidas, con lo que seguirá dando un buen servicio a sus clientes y podrá trabajar sin problema alguno.
Con el capital que se le prestó anteriormente Milagro fortaleció su negocio, aumento sus ventas, mejoro el servicio, sus ganancias son mejores, y sus logros han sido poder cancelar sus cuotas así como también dar apoyo incondicional a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Milagro has decided to apply for another loan so that she can purchase supplies for her pupusas sales business. She sells tostados, pupusas and food. On this occasion she'll purchase flour, plantains, vegetables and an assortment of beverages. That way she'll continue to provide good service for her customers and she'll be able to work without any problems.
With the money from the previous loan Milagro strengthened her business, increased her sales, improved her service, and her profits are higher. She succeeded in making her repayments and also in giving unconditional support to her children in their studies.

loans.use: to purchase flour, plantains, vegetables, and an assortment of beverages.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store, increasing sales, and also helping to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of products, in particular food and beverages, to stock her store.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new accessories and phone cards for selling at her store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

Nga hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store, increasing sales, and also improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy phone cards and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong, 50, is married and has one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband run a food stall in front of their house. 

Phuong started this business one year ago. She sells crab soup eaten with noodles to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying good quality food to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy good quality food to better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Len

texts.en:
Len is 50 years old and is married. She has been running a cafe in front of her door for 10 years. She started this business to cover her expenses, and raise her child. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Len is requesting a loan to expand her business by offering more food and many kinds of soft drinks so that she will be able to increase the turnover in her business. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest to her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more food and many kinds of soft drinks for her cafe

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga is a 37-year-old married woman. She lives with two daughters, one son, and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. For four years, she and her husband have been earning money by running a business of making cake to sell.

Nga would like a loan to purchase a greater quantity of ingredients to make sweet cakes and breads. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of ingredients to make sweet cakes and breads.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan, 35, is divorced and has one son. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns an income running a food stall in front of her house. 

She started this business twenty-five years ago. She sells noodles to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying good quality food to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy good quality food to better satisfy her customers

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages

loans.name: Asiya's Group

texts.en:
Asiya is a member of a three person lending group. She has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She belongs to a deprived family. Her husband is the only earning person in the family. He is a blacksmith. He has a general knowledge of how to make and repair many things, from the most complex of weapons to simple things like nails.

He produces objects such as gates, grilles, railings, light fixtures, furniture, tools, cooking utensils, and weapons and sells them in the main market. He works very hard to meet the family's needs. Currently, the stock of iron is finished, due to which he is unable to continue his work. Asiya therefore wants to help her husband to purchase iron for manufacturing iron products. This will help her husband to continue generating income to fulfill the family's needs. 

Asiya says thanks to BRAC Pakistan and KIVA lenders. Note: In the picture Asiya raises her hand.

loans.use: To purchase iron for manufacturing iron products.

loans.name: Luu

texts.en:
Luu is 40 years old and is married with three daughters. She and her husband have been running a business of  buying, raising, and selling earth worms for 20 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more stock, equipment, and materials to rear earthworms for selling. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest to her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more stock, equipment, and materials to rear worms

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia es de una familia de tres miembros, sus metas futuras son comenzar a ejercer su profesión en alguna Institución pública y ejercer la Docencia para así mejorar los ingresos económicos de su familia.
Su inspiración es su madre, que con mucho sacrificio ha logrado su formación profesional.
Patricia está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, y está luchando por ser una excelente profesional.
Pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de universidad, y así seguir luchando por su meta.
texts.en: Patricia's comes from a family of three.  Her ambitions for the future are to pursue her career in a public institution and to work in teaching so as to improve her family's income.  She takes inspiration from her mother who made many sacrifices to do her vocational training. Patricia is studying nursing and striving to be an outstanding professional.  She is seeking this loan to pay her university fees and, as a result, continue striving to achieve her ambition.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El señor José de  47 años de edad, vive con su esposo,  tiene 04 hijos que dependen de él,  tiene casa propia, se dedica desde hace 08 años al negocio de venta de  tierra para las ladrilleras.
Don José transporta el producto en su carreta de bueyes, el compra tierra y el barro para luego revenderlos con sus clientes que se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos y tejas.
Don José  está solicitando el préstamo para compra de tierra y barro. Con el apoyo del crédito el pretende mejorar su condición de vida, ya que necesita el capital de trabajo para hacer posible su negocio, en sus ratos libres fabrica ladrillos y tejas, es su quinto préstamo que solicita. 

 San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Señor José is 47 years old. He lives with his wife and has four dependent children. He has his own house. He has worked for 8 years in the business of selling soil for brickworks.

Don José transports the product in his oxcart. He buys soil and clay to later sell them to his customers, who manufacture bricks and tiles.

Don José is applying for the loan to buy soil and clay. With the help of the loan, he expects to improve his living conditions, since he needs working capital to make his business possible. In his free time, he makes bricks and tiles. This is the fifth loan that he has applied for.

 San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2013.

loans.use: to buy soil and clay for his business

loans.name: Santos Eustacio

texts.es:
El señor Santos de 60 años de edad, vive con su esposa y su nieto,  tiene casa propia, se dedica desde hace 30 años al negocio de venta de  tejas, ladrillos, cultivo de maíz y cría de ganado.
Don Santos su negocio es en su casa y su venta es con los amigos y personas que lo conocen, el es una persona trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante.
Don Santos está solicitando el préstamo para compra de materia prima como tierra y barro que son la materia prima que usa para fabricar los ladrillos, al igual que la leña.
Don Santos  con el apoyo de este crédito él pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es su sexto crédito que solicita a Prisma, su sueño es mejorar su taller y trabajar duro este nuevo año.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Santos is 60 years old and lives with his wife and his grandson. He owns his own house. He has been working for more than 30 years in the business of selling roof tiles and bricks, farming corn, and raising cattle. 

Santos’s business is in his house and he sells to friends and people who know him. He is a hardworking person with a desire to get ahead.

Santos is requesting a loan to buy raw materials such as clay, which is the raw material that he uses to make the bricks, and also firewood.

Santos will use the loan to improve his income and also his quality of life. This is the sixth loan that he has requested from Prisma. His dream is to improve his workshop and to work hard this coming year.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – November 2013.

loans.use: to buy clay for his business

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru: Фариде 46 лет. Она вдова и имеет 2 детей. Фарида сама вырастила своих детей, так как ее муж умер молодым. Она после смерти мужа поступила на работу в сельской школе техничкой. Ее зарплата очень маленькая и не хватает для обеспечения семьи. Она 3 месяца назад начала свой бизнес скотоводством. Фарида хочет развевать свой новый бизнес. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация деловых Женщин. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 500 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы развевать свой новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Farida is 46 years old. She is a widow and has two children. Farida has raised her children by herself since her husband died young. After her husband died, she went to work as a janitor in a rural school. Her salary is very small and is not enough to support the family. Three months ago she started her livestock breeding business. Farida wants to expand the new business. Therefore, she studied in the course "Bring It On" organized by the Association of Business Women. She is requesting a loan of 500 TJS to buy cattle to expand her new business. She is waiting for your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: buy cattle to start a new business

loans.name: Spartak

texts.en:
Spartak lives with his parents, grandmother, sister, and brother. Near Yerevan town, Spartak and his family own a plot of land where they grow peach, apricot, cherry and plum trees. They also keep 2 cows and 10 turkeys. The whole family works hard to gather a good harvest and sell it. 

Because of a difficult financial position, Spartak and his family are unable to improve their farm and enlarge the agribusiness.  

Spartak has applied for this loan to purchase forage for feeding the livestock and fertilizer for the trees. 

As this is Spartak's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. This first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. 

Spartak and his family will be very grateful for the support and goodwill of lenders and they hope for the loan.

loans.use: to pay for forage for the livestock and fertilizer

loans.name: Anita O.

texts.en:
Anita is a college student who is married and has four children whose ages are between 15 and 32. Anita is good at managing her business which she has been doing for 12 years now, selling charcoal in the market of Logan Town area. 

With the loan proceeds, she will buy charcoal to resell. She said that besides fewer goods on her market table, she has no other problem for now. She received a little money from her husband to establish her business, and learned this way of  selling from her friends. She enjoys the flow of her customers, and her plan is to increase her business even more.

loans.use: buy charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Jamal Al-Hodeida Group

texts.en:
This group, Jamal Al-Hodeida, consists of four ladies. They work in their businesses daily to increase their profits and provide a good living for their families. They live in Hodeida, Yemen.  

Karosha is recently the leader of the group in this loan. She is a 32-year-old married woman who has four children. She sells ice cream and food. She started her business to assist her husband in providing for their family. This business allows her to meet her family's needs without much difficulty. She obtains her supplies at a market in the city. 

She has requested a second loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy ice cream and food to expand her business. 

She hopes to diversity her business to generate more profit. 

She thanks Kiva lenders for funding the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy ice cream and food to expand her business.

loans.name: Dina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Dina nunca tuvo la oportunidad de ir a la escuela, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja en la agricultura y le ayuda a vender a ella también, tiene 3 hijos y viven con ellos, están en la escuela y nadie mas vive con ellos.

 Dina se dedica a la venta de ropa desde que tiene 8 años, pues fue con su mamá que aprendió el negocio, su madre desde muy pequeña la llevaba a vender con ella y fue así que a ella le fue gustando el negocio y ahora continúa en el negocio de la ropa.  Ella compra en la capital y algunas veces en otra ciudad. Tiene que viajar desde su cantón hasta la capital en bus, el bus tarda 2 horas para llegar hasta donde ella compra, luego de comprar regresa a su cantón para venderlo, ella lo hace en su caserío vecino, donde comienza su día a las 5 de la mañana para preparar el desayuno a sus hijos y al esposo, luego prepara su  venta y sale a las 8 de la mañana y regresa a las 2 de la tarde para atender a su familia.


El préstamo será utilizado, en el negocio de ropa, donde comprará 3 docenas de brasiel, 2 docenas de blumeres, 2 de tangas, una docena de faldas, una docena de calcetines, una docena de mochilas, con el préstamo podrá comprar por mayor y mas barato por lo que le quedará mas ganancia.


Su sueño es poder comprar un terreno y dejarles un puesto a cada uno de sus hijos, otro de sus sueños es que sus hijos se preparen con una carrera universitaria, ya que ella no tuvo la oportunidad, con la ganancia espera pagar el crédito y ahorrar para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Dina never had the chance to go to school. She lives with her partner, who works in agriculture and also helps her with her sales. They have three children, who all live at home and are in school. No one else lives with them.

Dina has been in the business of selling clothing for eight years, work that she learned from her mother. When Dina was very young, her mother would take her on her sales rounds, and that was how Dina grew to like the business that she continues on today. She buys in the capital, and sometimes from another city. She has to travel from her canton by bus to the capital, about 2 hours to reach the place she buys from. She then returns to her canton to sell her products. She does this in a neighboring village, where she starts her day at 5am to make breakfast for her children and husband. She then prepares her sales and goes out at 8 in the morning, returning at 2 in the afternoon to take care of her family.

This loan will be used for her clothing business to purchase, specifically, 3 dozen bras, 2 dozen undies, 2 dozen thongs, a dozen skirts, a dozen pairs of socks, and a dozen backpacks. The loan will let her purchase these things at the cheaper wholesale price so that she earns more from her sales.

Her dream is to buy some land and leave a piece of it to each of her children. Another dream of hers is that her children will be ready for a career at university, since that was an opportunity she never had. With her earnings, she expects to pay off this loan and save to expand her business.

loans.use: buy clothing for resale at wholesale prices.

loans.name: María De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
María de 43 años de edad, solo estudió cuarto grado debido a que su papá las abandonó y quedó solo con su mamá y ella para sostener el hogar la mandaba a vender y por eso dejó la escuela, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos que viven con ella y ninguno estudia.

María se dedica al comercio de mariscos desde que tiene 8 años, pues fue su mamá quien la mandaba a vender y así aprendió el negocio, ella siempre se ha dedicado solo a este negocio. Para comprar los productos, ella camina desde el caserío donde vive unos 15 minutos a pie para tomar el bus que la lleva hasta su destino, el bus recorre una hora y media; luego compra la mercadería, la prepara y de una sola vez se va hasta la ciudad que es donde vende en el mercado, en ocasiones lo hace también de casa en casa en los caseríos aledaños donde ella vive. Ella se levanta a las 5:00 AM para prepararse y conducirse al trabajo, sale de su casa a las 6:30 AM y regresa a casa a las 5:30 PM, esa es su rutina diaria.  


El préstamo será invertido, para comprar 50 libras de pescado, 50 libras de camarón, 25 libras de chacalines, jaibas y mas. El préstamo mejorará en que comprará más productos y más baratos y también que se evitará viajar todos los días para ir a comprar, por lo tanto le quedará mas ganancia.

Sus sueños, construir una casa de ladrillo, ya que la que hoy tiene es de adobe y ya no sirve, comprar un terreno y dejarles un puesto a cada uno de sus hijos, con la ganancia espera pagar el crédito y tener las puertas abiertas de la institución, además ahorrar para poder cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old. She only stayed in school through the fourth grade, when her father left her and her mother. To keep the family afloat, her mother sent her out to sell and she had to leave school. She is a single mother and has three children, none of whom are in school.

María has been in the business of selling seafood for eight years now. Ever since her mother sent her out to sell and she learned how, she's been a saleswoman all her life. To buy her products, she walks from her home village some 15 minutes to catch a bus that will take her where she needs to go. The bus takes an hour and a half. She buys her merchandise, prepares it, then goes to the city where she sells her goods. She sometimes also sells from door to door in the villages near where she lives. She wakes up at 5:00am to get ready for work, leaves her house at 6:30am, and returns home again at 5:30pm. This is her daily schedule.

This loan will be invested in her business through the purchase of 50 lbs of fish, 50 lbs of shrimp, and 25 lbs of crawfish, crabs, and more. This loan will help her by enabling her to purchase more products more cheaply, and will also mean she doesn't have to travel every single day to buy goods, which will leave her more of her income.

Her dreams include building a house of brick, since the adobe one she has now doesn't work, and buying some land and leaving some of it to each of her children. With her earnings, she hopes to pay off the loan and leave the doors of the institution open to her, and also to save toward her dreams.

loans.use: buy large quantities of fish for resale.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
Hernán tiene 52 años de edad, vive en Malacasi, una zona rural de Salitral, su población se dedica al comercio y agricultura, que pertenece a Morropon, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado caprino, que los ofrece en el mercado de la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para comprar ovejas para posteriormente engordarlos y ofrecerlos a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Hernán is 52 years old. He lives in Malacasi, a rural area of Salitral. Its people work in commerce and in agriculture. It is part of Morropón, located two hours from the city of Piura, on the north coast of Peru.

He raises and sells goats, which he offers in the area market. He has applied for a loan of 1000 PEN to buy sheep to fatten and later offer [for sale] at a better price.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Diana Iris

texts.es:
Diana Iris tiene 41 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos a en el distrito de Oyotun, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral en la parte posterior a su domicilio, Diana realiza esta labor para apoyar su esposo con los gastos familiares y ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados y así tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Diana Iris, 41, lives with her husband and two children in the district of Oyotun. The local people work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock. The town is located two hours away from the city of Chiclayo on the north coast of Peru.

Diana Iris raises and sells farm animals from the back part of her house. She does this work to support her husband with the household expenses. She has applied for a loan of 500 Peruvian soles to buy balanced feed so that she will have higher production to offer her clients, generating a higher income for her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten her animals.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a 31-year-old single woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a green grocery shop where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a suitable place and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be that some of the products are perishable. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add stock of vegetables and fruits. Her business goal is to be stable within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a business that serves everybody. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Wiliter

texts.en:
Wiliter is a 32-year-old married woman. She has four children, ages ranging from four years to 16 years. She describes herself to be hopeful and trustful. She operates a farm where she grows tea to sell. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her farm is located in a rural area, and her primary customers are small scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be fluctuations of tea prices.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more tea leaves for resale. Her business goal is to excel within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a bright future. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more tea leaves for resale.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 43 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. 

Fatima is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her livestock.

Fatima has been raising livestock for 3 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her livestock

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia works hard to support her family. She is single and has a medicine vending business in the Philippines. 
She has been in this business for nine years now.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of medicine to sell. In the future, Celia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of medicine to sell

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

Rosalie successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Rosalie's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Zion Christian Association Group

texts.en:
Winfred is a 35-year-old lady; she is married with five children of which three are school goers. She is an old client of our institution. 

She runs a retail shoe shop in Entebbe Kitoro town, which she started five years ago. She has been able to get income to cater to the needs of her family.

She has borrowed a loan of ugx.900,000 to add more stock of shoes to her shop. 

She mainly sells school shoes for children and she is targeting the season. 

She is so grateful to the institution because she has been able to boust her business by borrowing from our institution. She hopes to open up another shop to increase her income and savings with us.

She is a God-fearing lady, honest and loves her customers - that’s why her business has been able to last for long.

loans.use: To buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.en:
Guillermo, a farmer from Mexico State, is trying to improve the financial situation on his small farm by reducing input costs or increasing productivity, and ideally, both. His investment in a 40-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester will help him do exactly that. 

As is, his cows produce several wheelbarrows of manure per day; using the biodigester, this manure will be transformed through anaerobic digestion into essentially free, renewable fuel and potent biofertilizer. The biofuel, methane-rich biogas, will help Guillermo displace the expensive, non-renewable propane gas they currently use to cook and heat bathwater, while the biofertilizer will help improve Guillermo's maize yield without resorting to petroleum-based agrochemical fertilizers. 

Guillermo will save money while concurrently reducing his farm's environmental impact. This loan represents 41% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.use: to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a lumber yard business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 28 years and also earns more income from her general store.

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more wood to sell at her lumber yard business. Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more wood to sell.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Dinah works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing. Dinah is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, spices, fish, etc. for her food vending business.

Dinah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, spices, fish, etc

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en: Shirley is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling personal products in the Philippines. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 9,500 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of personal products to sell. NWTF is re-listing Shirley's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of personal products to sell.

loans.name: Sang

texts.en: Sang, 32, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including two sons and her husband. Sang earns money through hairdressing services while her husband earns a living as a soldier. Sang would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of hairdressing material and tools to better satisfy her customers. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of hairdressing material and tools to better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 55 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, biscuits, etc. to sell.

She has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from food vending. Edna aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, biscuits, etc. to sell.

loans.name: John Leonard

texts.en:
John Leonard is 19 years old and is the first of two children in the family. His mother Ana Marie supports the family through her food vending business in the Philippines.

John Leonard is studying Bachelor of Science in Marine Transportation and is currently in the third year of this three-year course.

He  is borrowing PHP 16,500 to pay tuition fees for the second semester of the school year 2013-14.

When he graduates, John Leonard plans to be gainfully employed so he can help improve the quality of life of his family

loans.use: to to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Karen Alejandra

texts.en:
Karen wants to work in the petroleum industry. She was accepted into the Universidad San Fransisco Xavier and is studying mining engineering. 

Now with the chance to achieve her dream, she is concerned about affording all the costs of her education. With a loan, Karen plans to buy her schoolbooks. Up until now, she has been managing to get by without them, but it has become a challenge. With books and school supplies, she feels she will be able to get better grades. 

She expects to graduate in October 2014, but without a loan, is unsure how she will be able to continue affording her education. She shares that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. Karen shares that it is important to her to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible. 

With a career in mining engineering, she expects to earn $25 a day. With two older siblings attending college already, Karen is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for schoolbooks.

loans.name: Nieves Sonia

texts.en:
Nieves wants to become a carpenter. To achieve her goal, Nieves has enrolled in Escuela Taller La Paz. She plans on graduating in April 2015, but without a loan from Vittana, she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can return to school. 

With this loan, Nieves plans on spending the money towards purchasing her textbooks. As an added expense, textbooks are often not bought to save money. With them, Nieves hopes to be able to better understand her subjects. 

In addition to her responsibilities at school, Nieves currently works 30 hours a week and earns $6 a day. With a degree in carpentry, she expects to earn $10 a day. With one younger brother and one younger sister, Nieves hopes to be a role model by being the first in her family to graduate from university.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks.

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
Samina is a 39-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 5 children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. From the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly so he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. Therefore, Samina has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Samina is so very thankful to Kiva.

Note: In the picture Samina raises her hand.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing a rickshaw.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel, de 43 años es una mujer trabajadora y muy responsable, es madre de un hijo, quien depende de su cuidado y protección para seguir adelante, vive en su casa propia desde donde lucha continuamente para mejorar su nivel de vida. Raquel  tiene como trabajo la confección de sus propios diseños de prendas de vestir de telas de licra y algodón. Ha establecido poco a poco su pequeño pero muy productivo taller en su casa en donde diseña y refacciona diferentes prendas de vestir. Cuenta que hace tiempo era trabajadora de una señora que distribuía sus prendas de vestir en un conocido centro comercial de la ciudad, pero con el paso de los años se dio cuenta que ella también podría realizar sus propios diseños y es así como emprendió esta nueva etapa. Trabaja ya 10 años en este. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que todos los días su dinero esta en movimiento y eso genera ingresos diarios, además de disponer de su tiempo, esta muy contenta con los créditos obtenidos en MFP por que dice que son muy bajos en cuanto al interés. Le gustaría más adelante poder tener un taller amplio y poder contratar a alguna señora que le pueda ayudar. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 800, está muy agradecida ya que empezó tan solo con una maquina y ahora trabajando con la institución pudo comprarse dos remalladotas y dos maquinas más; asegura estar contenta con su grupo ya que todos son muy cumplidas.
En esta oportunidad con el monto solicitado comprará telas, hilos y elásticos que usa en su trabajo diario.
texts.en:
Raquel is 43 years old and a hard-working and very responsible woman. She is a mother to one son, who depends on her for care and protection and to help him to prosper. Raquel owns the house where she lives and it is there that she is fighting to improve her living conditions. Raquel works making clothes of her own designs - she works with cotton and Lycra. Little by little Raquel has established a small but very productive workshop in her home where she designs and produces different clothing items. She tells us that some time ago she worked for a woman who sold her clothes in a well-known shopping centre in the city. As time went on, Raquel realised that she, too, could make her own designs and so she started this new stage in her life. She has now been doing this work for ten years and what she most likes about it is that she has money coming in every day. She also has free time with this work. Raquel is very happy with her loans from MicroFinanzas Prisma as she says that the interest rates are very low. In the future Raquel would like to have a larger workshop and to be able to hire another woman to help her. 

On this occasion, Raquel is applying for a loan of 800 Nuevo Soles. She is very grateful for this loan as she started with just one sewing machine but now she has two darners and two other sewing machines. Raquel says that she is very happy with her group as everyone adheres to their commitments. 

Raquel will use this loan to buy material, threads and elastic, which she will use in her daily work.

loans.use: to buy material, threads and elastic.

loans.name: Martin Bosco

texts.es:
Don Martin pertenece al municipio de  Niquinohomo, municipio que fue elegido para el programa de creación de alianzas para el fortalecimiento de las capacidades locales para el saneamiento de Nicaragua, es casado, con  45 años de edad,  Profesional, comerciante trabaja una pequeña pulpería desde hace 8 años. Su núcleo familiar lo conforman su esposa y sus dos hijos, uno mayor de edad. Toda la familia depende de los ingresos de su pequeño negocio.

Actualmente están aplicando para el proyecto de agua y saneamiento, a través de  un financiamiento para   instalar un  sistema de mejoramiento y ampliación de cerramiento, consiste en la instalación de un inodoro convencional con la construcción de sistema de tratamiento, esto lo requiere  ya que por donde el habita no es posible el acceso a aguas negras, por lo que para su uso la familiar cuenta con una  letrina, siendo su familia una de la miles que no tienen acceso al  saneamiento mejorado, con este proyecto que esta beneficiando a varios municipios del país, le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida  y  también contribuir con el medio ambiente. 
Sin la oportunidad de este crédito es imposible que Martin tenga acceso a un inodoro ya que es muy costoso. Con su bajo ingreso es imposible que logre instalar, estos programas vienen ayudar a familias en condiciones mas pobres, las letrinas causan enfermedades y contaminan el medio ambiente, es por ello que nace la idea de crear estas soluciones dirigidas al sector más pobres.
texts.en:
Martin, 45, lives in the town of Niquinohomo, which was chosen for the alliance creation program to strengthen local sanitation measures in Nicaragua. He is married and has worked as a vendor in a small store for eight years. His immediate family is comprised of his wife and two children, one who is an adult. The entire family depends on the income from his small business.

He is currently applying for the water and sanitation project through a loan to install a larger, better enclosure. This involves installing a conventional toilet with the construction of a treatment system. He needs this because where he lives, he doesn't have access to the sewage system. For this reason, his family uses a latrine; they are one of the thousands of families who don't have access to better sanitation. This project is benefiting various municipalities in the country and will allow for a better quality of life and it will also contribute to the environment.

Without the opportunity for this loan, it would be impossible for Martin to gain access to a toilet, which is very expensive. With his low income, it would be impossible to install. These programs help families living in extremely poor conditions. Latrines cause sickness and they contaminate the environment. This has led to the idea of finding solutions directed at the poorest areas.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a larger, improved enclosure with blocks, cement, ground rocks, tubing, and ceramic flooring.

loans.name: Maximina

texts.es:
Maximina tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el Caserío La Toma, una zona rural del distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad que se caracteriza por dedicarse a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Morropon, que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, también se dedica a la venta de camote, yuca y tubérculos, es una madre emprendedora que ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 600 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y una segunda parte para la compra de cerdos para posteriormente engordarlos y ofrecerlos a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
