The “Renacer 2” group is in its first cycle and they all want to be able to work together and help each other get ahead.  They are participating in the elimination of poverty survey, as part of the elimination of poverty program. 

Mirtha is one of the members who demonstrated a level two poverty level in the last survey.  That is to say that she is or medium income, but she must work to improve.  She sells frozen treats and says that thanks to her work, she is able to give her family what they need to get ahead, so that they need for nothing.

Mirtha is asking for this loan to buy supplies to make frozen treats.  This will help her complete her business plan, which will help her increase her income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Verónica Liliana

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito Virgen  Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Verónica, tiene  29 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos de 15, 13, 10 y 5 años, los mayores estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Verónica es una muy buena esposa y ama de casa que también se dedica a la venta ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja tres días a la semana en horas de la mañana, ella aprovecha que a estas horas sus hijos más pequeños están en la escuela y así le resulta más fácil salir, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana, lleva 4 años con su negocio con el cual ayuda a su marido con los gastos sobretodo con los de los estudios de sus  hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo de Crédito  y le gusta por los beneficios que les da el banco. Sus sueños son tener un barco más grande para que su marido realice sus labores de pesca.
texts.en:
The credit group "Virgen del Mar" meet every 15 days in the beautiful seaside resort of San Mateo in the city of Manta. 

It is known for its beautiful beaches which are visited year round by domestic and foreign tourists. In this area the majority of the population make a living by fishing or working in the sea. 

Veronica lives here. She is 29, married and has four children aged 15, 13, 10 and 5 years old. 

The older ones go to school. Her husband is a fisherman. 

Veronica is a very good wife and housewife who also sells all kinds of clothes. She sells door to door. She works three days a week in the mornings. 

She takes advantage of these hours since her youngest children are in school and this way it is easier for her to go out. 

She sells her clothes by credit and charges for them every week. She has had this business for the past four years. This is how she helps her husband with expenses, especially the education costs for their children. 

This loan will be used to but all types of clothes. She has been part of the credit group since the start and she likes the benefits given to her by the bank. 

Her dream is to have a bigger boat for her husband's fishing work.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Musrat

texts.en:
Musrat, age 51, is the leader of this borrower group. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband offers sheltering services. 

Musrat is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan amount to purchase bamboo, nails, and iron sheets for his business. 

With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to expand his business so that he can eventually construct a small house for his family. Musrat hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo, nails, and iron sheets for her husband's sheltering business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 52 years old and married with three children. Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Reinerio

texts.es:
Reinerio tiene 28 años de edad, vive en el Caserío Chaupe, una zona rural del distrito de Querocotillo, una comunidad con paisajes verdes, su población se dedica a la ganadería, agricultura y comercio, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Cutervo, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura cultiva maíz y menestras como frejol, alverja, entre otros, desde hace 8 años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos y de esta manera tener una buena producción para ofrecerlo a sus clientes, generando ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Reinerio is 28 years old and lives in the Chaupe village, a rural area of the district of Querocotillo. It is a community of green landscapes, and its people work in stockbreeding, agriculture, and trade. It is located two hours from the city of Cutervo, which belongs to the Cajamarca region, on the northern coast of Peru. 

He has worked in agriculture for 8 years, cultivating corn and legumes like beans and peas, among others. He has requested a loan of 2000 nuevos soles for the purchase of fertilizer in order to maintain his crops and in this way have a good production to offer to his customers. In this way, he would generate income for a better quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the cultivation of legumes.

loans.name: Malika

texts.en:
Malika is a freshman in the Journalism and Mass Communications Program. This is her story:

"At the beginning, I want to say that choosing a profession is a very important thing for me. When I was small, I dreamed to become an actress and be in public. Later this dream faded, and I started to love reading and writing. Therefore I have chosen to study journalism.

I think that journalism offers an opportunity to constantly develop and not stand still. Since childhood I have been very curious. I liked to compose short stories and then tell them in the afternoons to my parents and at night to my toys. 

In addition, journalism is a true art. I think that the ability to write to inform society requires lots of talent. Journalists are always in the center of events, and they have to interpret the events for the reader. 

In conclusion, I consider journalism like an adventure not only around the world, but also in knowing yourself. And I want to begin this adventure at the American University of Central Asia."

loans.use: to pay for higher education.

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es: El señor Jhonny es soltero, logró cursar hasta el nivel bachiller y no tiene hijos bajo su dependencia. Es una persona responsable y trabaja en una empresa de fabricación de mezcladoras de cemento. Vive con su madre quien se encuentra muy enferma y requiere de mucho cuidado, los ingresos que obtiene son destinados a cubrir sus gastos y los de su mamá, como ahora no cuenta con dinero disponible, solicita un crédito con el que pueda realizar la refacción de su vivienda,  ya que tiene algunos deterioros como goteras, rajaduras y otros, de esta manera lograra mejorar las condiciones en las que vive.
texts.en: Jhonny is single, no dependents, and has a bachelor’s degree.  He is a hardworking, responsible person and works for a company making cement mixers.  He lives with his mother, who is sick and needs lots of care.  He uses his income to cover his mother’s expenses and at the moment he doesn’t have any disposable income.  He is asking for a loan so he can make repairs to his house because it has some leaks, cracks, and other things wrong with it.  In this way he will improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to repair his home.

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en: Mrs. Oyunchimeg, 43, lives with her husband, daughter and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been running a barbershop since 1992 and her husband provides automobile repair services to local people. Their daughter studies at a university and due to an increase in university tuition fees, they didn't pay fully. Therefore, Oyunchimeg is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to pay the tuition fee. She thinks the best thing she can do for her daughter is to invest in her daughter's education.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a 38-year-old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 17 years. She describes herself to be very industrious and she operates a store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 9 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are mostly women. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of clothes. She will use the 25,000 KES loan to add to her stock of clothes. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM. Eunice's previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add to her stock of clothes.

loans.name: La's Group

texts.en:
A villager from the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, La is 34 years old and married. She has three children. The main source of her family’s income is from selling grocery items. Having been in this business for 14 years, she is able to earn daily income of KHR 60,000 to support her family and she can save about KHR 20,000 per day for future needs. 

This is the fourth loan for La with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Taatiaategalu

texts.en:
Taatiaategalu is a 28-year-old married woman with four children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro, ta'amu, yams, and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for over two years. 

Taatiaategalu needs a loan to buy chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, and rakes. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2013.

Taatiaategalu will use the profits from her sales to improve her plantation, to support her family, and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, and rakes

loans.name: Falematai

texts.en:
Falematai is a 31-year-old married woman who has two children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as sugar, salt, tauaga [cloth], vegetables, handicrafts and daily use products. She has been doing this for many years. 

Falematai needs a loan to buy a freezer, cooler, new cash box, boxes of canned fish, bags of sugar, bags of rice etc. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business. She became a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, cooler, new cash box, boxes of canned fish, bags of sugar, bags of rice etc.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is married with three children. She manages her own piggery while her husband works as a government employee. 

Liza has been growing and selling pigs in town for three years, and she earns well from this. 

She took a new loan from Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to buy piglets to raise. 

In the future, Liza wants to expand her piggery business in order to have a better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a 32-year-old woman. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a clothing store. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of clothes. Her business goal is to open other business outlets within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add stock of clothes.

loans.name: Wahyuni

texts.en:
Wahyuni is 26 years old and lives in Pejarakan, North Bali.  She is married and has a toddler.  Her husband work as a mason. She has a small kiosk in front of her house where she sells daily needs for families such as rice, oil, soap, kitchen needs, etc. She has been in this business since 2009.  

Wahyuni is seeking a loan of 2,000,000 IDR from MUK to expand her business. With the loan, she will purchase more snacks to stock in her kiosk and buy a glass rack to display her merchandise.  With her earnings, she hopes to be able to save for her future needs and fullfill her family needs.

loans.use: To purchase more snacks to sell and a glass rack to display her merchandise

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Kalpana is a 30-year-old housewife. She is the mother of two children. Her husband Jayanta is 31 years and a farmer by profession. Both of them are illiterate and can only sign their name. Both their children are studying in school. They live in their own kaccha house (made of mud and straw) in the small village of Altagram in the small town Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri district.

Kalpana’s husband has been farming for many years on their own small amount of land. Financially, she wants to support her husband as well as to contribute to her family. She is interested in growing potatoes to enhance their farming business.  

Kalpana heard about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and applied for a loan to purchase potato seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for the cultivation of potatoes on their land. She hopes this business will enable her to improve her standard of living as well as their income.  She dreams of building a pakka (concrete) house in the future with the profit from her business.

loans.use: To purchase good quality potato seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 43-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 5 children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver. Recently his rickshaw has not been working properly so he is unable to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore Parveen has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw, allowing him to continue his business. Parveen is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en:
Ariel is 32 years old and has one child. He has managed a farming business for 10 years.

According to Ariel, while managing a farming business, he has experienced a lot of difficulties like weather conditions. But, through his faith and hard work, he overcame all the obstacles in life.

Due to these difficulties, he is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase sacks of fertilizer and seeds for his farming business.

Ariel hopes to obtain his requested loan amount so he can keep his farming business productive and profitable all throughout the growing season.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer and seeds for his farming business

loans.name: Horn

texts.en:
A 23-year-old mother of four children, Horn resides in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district in Cambodia. To support herself, she has been growing cassava and rice for several years. Sometimes, she and her husband work for others for a fee to earn extra income. Together, they can earn about KHR 32,000 per day for current expenses and can save about KHR 13,000 each day for the future needs.  

This is the first loan for Horn with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is applying for a loan of KHR 1,500,000 and she will use this loan to buy pesticides for her cultivated land and to spend for labor fees. She also wants to use this loan to buy piglets for raising and pig feed for feeding them. She hopes to fatten her pigs and grow her rice and cassava she she can sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for her cultivated land.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
As a 27-year-old mother residing in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Neang has two children to take care of and earns a living through planting cassava. To supplement her income, her husband works for others for a fee and catches fish. Having been in this business for six years, she can earn about 11 USD per day to make a living and can save about 2 USD each day for her future needs. 

Neang is a six-loan-cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is requesting a new loan. With this loan, she will buy pesticides for her cassava and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to make more cassava to increase her family’s income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and pay labor fees

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito Virgen  Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene  32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos 9 y 4 años, la mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Ana tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otras cosas, a pesar de que su tienda es pequeña sus clientes consiguen de todo, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, tiene su negocio 7 años con el cual saca adelante a su familia.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, entre otros productos. Es fundadora del  Banco Comunal hace más de 15 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le brinda la institución. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en: The loan group Virgen del Mar convenes every 15 days in the beautiful resort of San Mateo in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches that are frequented all year round by national tourists and foreigners.  In this area, the majority of the inhabitants are dedicated to fishing and maritime industries.  Ana lives in this area - she is 32 years old, married and has two children who are 4 and 9 years old.  Her older child is a student.  Ana's husband is dedicated to fishing.  Doña Ana has a grocery store in her house where she sells products such as rice, sugar, oils, and detergents, among other things. In spite of the fact that her store is small, her customers get everything.  She works every day from 6am until 8pm and sometimes, until later.  She has had her business for 7 years, it is through this business that she helps to improve things for her family.  This loan will be used to better stock her store, to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, among other things.  Ana was a founder of the Communal Bank more than 15 years ago, and she likes the support that the institution offers.  Her dream is to give the very best to her children.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents and other products.

loans.name: María Janeth

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito Virgen  Del Mar  se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.
La señora María es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ella financia su negocio, tiene 36  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 18, 14 y 9 años de edad, los dos menores estudian en  colegio y escuela. Todos sus hijos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña María es una gran ama de casa que realiza el crédito para que su esposo tenga los recursos necesarios para poder realizar su trabajo, su esposo se dedica a la pesca, el junto a otras personas se van a alta mar en su pequeña embarcación a realizar sus faenas de pesca, ellos salen en la tarde y no llegan sino hasta después de tres a cuatro días con los productos que le mar les da, una vez en la playa entregan los productos a comerciantes mayoristas para que estos los distribuyan a toda la provincia. Llevan más de 20  años  dedicados a esta dura labor con la cual el saca a su familia adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar redes, piolas, combustibles y alimentos para los días que tienen que estar en alta mar. Sus sueños son tener un gran barco para que su esposo realice sus faenas de pesca.
texts.en:
The loan group Virgen del Mar convenes every 15 days in the beautiful resort of San Mateo in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches that are frequented all year round by national tourists and foreigners. In this area, the majority of the inhabitants are dedicated to fishing and maritime industries.
Maria is a founding member of the Communal Bank and she likes it because with the credit, she finances her business.  She is 36 years old, married, and has 3 children - 18, 14 and 9 years old.  The two younger children study in high school and elementary school.  All her children still live at home.  Her husband is dedicated to fishing.  Doña María is a housewife that uses the loan so that her husband has the necessary resources to be able to do his job.  Her husband, along with others, goes out to sea in a small boat to do his fishing.  They leave in the afternoon and do not come back until three or four days later, with whatever products they were able to get from the ocean.  Once on the beach, they deliver their catch to wholesalers who distributes them to the rest of the province.  For more than 20 years, they have been dedicated to this difficult line of work, which is what helps to support his family.  This loan is to buy nets, lanyards, gasoline, and food for the days that they have to be out at sea.  Their dream is to have a large boat so that her husband can do their fishing.

loans.use: to buy nets, lanyard, fuel, and food.

loans.name: Imrana's Group

texts.en:
Imrana is a responsible housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a blacksmith. He manufacture iron and steel products and sells them in the main market. He needs capital to purchase things needed for his work.

Therefore, his wife Imrana, as a member of a three-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. He will purchase spare parts, steel and iron to manufacture products to sell.

Imrana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts, steel and iron to manufacture products to sell.

loans.name: Hameeda

texts.en:
Hameeda is 45 years old, widowed and lives with her three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her elder son is responsible for all household expenses. He provides sheltering (construction) services along with his team. He has been working as a laborer, but new he wants to start his own business providing sheltering services. However, due to the lack of funds, he is unable to buy sheltering material of his own.

Therefore, Hameeda requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner so her son would be able to buy sheltering mateirla such as bamboo, planks and wooden boards etc.
 
Hameeda thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy sheltering material like bamboo, planks and boards.

loans.name: Azamat

texts.en:
Azamat is a freshman in the Software Engineering Program. This is his story:

American University of Central Asia is the most well-known university in Central Asia. I am lucky and proud to say that AUCA is located precisely in my country, and it gives me an amazing opportunity to get an American education without having to leave home. I have been interested in technology since I was in high school. People could see my interest while I was trying to fix computers and other electronics. I really like to figure out problems by myself, but I also wanted to learn more about computers and how they work. AUCA’s Software Engineering program is what I want to study.

Along with obtaining an education, my next goals are to discover something new and incredible in technology, and to devise more valuable and practical pieces of technology. I would like to work for a place like Google or Microsoft, and I know that several AUCA Alumni from Software Engineering already work for these places.

loans.use: to pay for higher education

loans.name: Dominga Clementina

texts.es: Dominga Clementina es comerciante de calzado en su casa de habitación y su esposo vende reses en un departamento lejano de la capital, ella es muy trabajadora y lucha por el bienestar de su hogar, solicita el crédito para construir una canaleta para que el agua se filtre por ahí y de paso cambiar parte del techo de la vivienda, para mejorar su hogar y sobre todo tener seguridad  y confort en su vejez.
texts.en: Dominga Clementina is a footwear retailer in her home and her husband sells cattle in an area far from the capital.  She is very hard-working and fights for the well-being of her home.  She requests a loan to build a chute so that water can filter through it and then change part of the roof of the property, to improve her home and above all, so that she can have security and comfort in her old age.

loans.use: to buy a metallic chute, zinc sheets and perlines.

loans.name: Celeste

texts.en:
A $1000 loan is offered to Celeste to improve her business. She is married, and she has five children. She has a second-hand store where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as long sleeve and short sleeve shirts, boys' clothes, and girls' clothes. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2005. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Celeste independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future. Her husband is a farmer, and he also planted coffee trees around the house. In addition, he maintains two buffaloes, four pigs, and two chickens. She is happy with this loan because it is offered to poor people to improve her living condition in the future.

loans.use: To buy articles of clothing to sell

loans.name: Masina

texts.en:
Masina is a 42-year-old woman who is married with one child. She runs a business sewing and selling clothes in her community and at the market. She has 10 years of experience with this business. 

Masina has requested a loan to buy scissors, a new sewing machine, and fabrics and to buy an iron roof for home improvement. She plans to use her profits to expand her business and to pay her child's school fees. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy scissors, a new sewing machine, and fabrics and to buy an iron roof for home improvement.

loans.name: Itagia

texts.en:
Itagia is a 50-year-old divorced woman with 3 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, bananas, and vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. 

Itagia has requested a loan to buy a chainsaw, bush knives, an ax, and chemicals. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Itagia hopes to improve her house and support her family.

loans.use: to buy a chainsaw, bush knives, an ax, and chemicals

loans.name: Zorigt

texts.en:
Zorigt is 55 years old and lives with his wife and two children in their small house in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. His wife Oyun-Erdene is unable to work because of her health condition. His older daughter is a university student and his younger son is enrolling in the university next year.

Zorigt has been driving a heavy truck for years, since he was young, and he started his taxi service business in town in 2005. He is getting older and his ability to work longer hours is getting lower so he has just decided to work at a local driver's school as a driving teacher based on his years of experience. He needs his own car to provide the training and is now requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase a secondhand training car to start his business under a licensed driver's school. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says, "My children are getting bigger and now enrolled in the university. Thus the family expenses increased, so i need to work hard to make enough to cover my family expenses and children's education fees"

loans.use: to purchase a secondhand training car to start his business under a licensed driver's school

loans.name: Penda

texts.fr: PENDA est une promotrice qui évolue dans la commercialisation des légumes et la culture maraichère. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Les charges quotidiennes sont gérées par son mari et ses grands enfants.  PENDA a une expérience de plus de 30ans. Elle sollicite ce crédit d’un montant de 150.000F pour acheter des semences et intrants. Elle commence sa journée à 10h pour la finir à 18h. Elle souhaite à l’avenir avoir un champ agricole moderne et des machines pour diversifier sa production et augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en: Penda is a promoter who works in vegetable commerce and market gardening. She is married with children. The daily expenses are managed by her husband and her grown children. Penda has over 30 years' experience. She requests a loan of 150.000F to buy seeds and fertilizer. She starts her day at 10am and finishes at 6pm. In the future she hopes to have a field for modern farming and some machines in order to diversify her produce and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy seeds to cultivate and sell vegetables.

loans.name: Siguidiale Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SIGUIDIALE est composé exclusivement de femmes mariées. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans, 5 enfants et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de SADIOBOUGOU commune de WACORO préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de savons, du lait, d’arachide et des rideaux..                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe SIGUIDIALE sont à leur premier prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                                 
La cliente AIRA la première personne assise à gauche est couturière et vendeuse de rideaux. Elle compte acheter les tissus que elle-même va coudre en rideaux. Ces rideaux seront vendus à ses clients potentiels. Elle compte faire un bénéfice mensuel de 10000FCFA qui sera pour dans l’élevage d’ovins et caprins.
texts.en:
The Siguidiale group is made up of exclusively of married women, who average 38 years of age with five children each. They all live in extended traditional families in the village of Sadiobougou, which lies in the Wacoro municipality of the Dioila prefecture in the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region).

They got to know each other either because they were relatives, neighbors or friends. They buy and sell soap, milk, groundnut and curtains, and are on their first group loan.

The customer, Aira, who is sitting on the far left of the photo, makes and sells curtains. She is planning to buy fabric which she will make up herself into curtains. These curtains will be sold to potential customers. She expects to make a monthly profit of 10,000FCFA, which will be used to raise sheep and goats.

loans.use: to buy fabric for curtains.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Ines vive con su hija en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz. se dedica al comercio de venta de prendas de vestir. Ines necesita el crédito para poder Comprar mas mercaderia y aprovechar las fiestas de fin de año ya que existe mayor venta y asi poder tener un mayor ingreso y cubrir los gastos familiares, y dar gustos a su hija.

El sueño de Ines es poder reunir el suficiente dinero para comprarse una casita propia y dar el mejor de los estudios a su hija.
texts.en:
Ines lives with her daughter in the Tembladerani area, city of La Paz. She sells clothes. Ines is requesting a loan to buy more clothes and take advantage of the holidays, when her sales increase. She will make more profits and will be able to cover her family’s expenses and give her daughter what she wants.

Ines’s dream is to be able to save enough money to buy her own house and pay for the best education possible for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy clothes for men and women.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery tiene 27 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales patos, gallos, gallinas, pollos en la parte posterior a su domicilio con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde se sus animales y una segunda parte para adquirir cerdos y de esta manera generar ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
Mery is 27 years old and lives with her two children in Oyotún, located in the northern coast of Peru, two hours away from the city of Chiclayo. Locals work in agriculture, commerce and livestock.

Mery raises and sells animals, such as ducks, roosters, hens and chickens. She has been working with this activity, in her backyard, for more than ten years. She is now requesting a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy feed to fatten her animals and to buy pigs. This investment will result in a higher income for her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi a 37ans et mère de famille. Pour améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants, elle fait la vente de produits d’alimentation. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et expose ses produits à la devanture de sa maison. Elle sollicite au près de WAGES un cinquiéme prêt pour faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante.
texts.en: Akouvi is 37 years old and the mother of two children. To improve her children’s living conditions, she sells food products. She purchases her supplies at the Lomé Grand Market and sells her merchandise in front of her house. She is seeking her fifth loan from WAGES so that she can meet her customers' steadily increasing demand.

loans.use: to purchase food products for resale.

loans.name: Wilfredo Agustin

texts.es:
Agustín tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Pomahuaca, su población se dedica a la agricultura y comercio a dos horas con veinte minutos de la ciudad de Jaén, que se encuentra ubicada en la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público en una combi, trasladando a sus clientes a una zona aledaña a su distrito, junto a su esposa tienen una pequeña bodega ubicada en su propio domicilio donde ofrecen productos de primera necesidad.

Agustin ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abarrotes menestras, leche azúcar, arroz, enlatados entre otros para abasttcer s negocio y una segunda parte para darle mantenimiento a su vehículo y de esta manera generar ingresos mayores para su familia.
texts.en:
Agustín, 36, lives with his wife in the district of Pomahuaca whose local people are involved in agriculture and commerce.  It is located two hours and twenty minutes from the city of Jaén and is in the Cajamarca Region, in the northern mountain range of Peru.

He provides a public transportation service with his mini-van and takes customers to a neighboring community in the district.  He and his wife have a small store in their home where they sell staple goods.

Agustín has requested a loan in the amount of 2,000 PEN to buy groceries, soups, milk, sugar, rice, canned goods and other items for the store.  The rest of the loan will be used to pay for vehicle maintenance so he can earn more income for the family.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance and to stock his grocery business.

loans.name: Naboti Group

texts.fr: La cliente Ntabara est une commerçante depuis 4 ans et membre d’un collectif d’affaires «Naboti », âgée de 22 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants, dont 1 étudie et 2 autres sont encore gosses. Elle est vendeuse souliers usagers. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 50 paires de souliers. Son conjoint, lui aussi, est commerçant. Elle avait débuté avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle et la construire, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour avoir bien choisi sa cible, en apportant un soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, tout en leur accordant des crédits sans garantie matérielle, surtout, pendant, la période poste conflit dans la région de l’Est Pays.
texts.en:
The client Ntabara has been a merchant for four years and is a member of the business collective "Naboti." She is 22 years old, and married with three children, one of whom is studying as the others are still too young. She sells used shoes. She is requesting a loan from Hekima to expand her business. Ntabara will use her loan to buy 50 pairs of shoes. Ntabara started her enterprise with funds she received from her husband, who is a merchant as well.

In the future, she wants to buy a plot on which to build, and to educate and feed her children. She thanks Hekima for their chosen purpose of providing support to women entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system, by providing them with loans without collateral, especially during the post-conflict period in the east of the country.

loans.use: to purchase 50 pairs of shoes.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Wildor

texts.es:
Wildor tiene 34 años de edad vive junto a sus hijos en el distrito de Pomahuaca su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada a dos horas con veinte minutos de la ciudad de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca sierra norte del Perú.

EL se dedica a la agricultura, cultivo y venta de piña, desde hace 10 años, es un padre emprendedor que se esfuerza en la labor que realiza ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para invertirlo en la compra de fertilizantes para su cultivo y pago de mano de obra para la cosecha y de esta manera tener una buena producción de piñas para ofrecer a sus clientes generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Wildor, 34, lives with his son in the district of Pomahuaca, a place where the local people are involved in agriculture, commerce and livestock farming.  It is located two hours and twenty minutes from the city of Jaén which belongs to the Cajamara Region in the northern mountain range of Peru.

He earns a living as a farmer and grows and sells pineapple, which he has been doing for ten years.  He is an enterprising father who works hard in what he does; and he is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,000 PEN to buy fertilizer for his crop and hire workers for the harvest season.  This will give him a good pineapple production to offer to customers so he can earn more income for the family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and hire workers for his pineapple harvest.

loans.name: Dilma Floricelda

texts.es:
Dilma es una joven de 22 años de edad la cual es madre soltera de un hijo quien es menor de edad, agricultora y ama de casa ya que desde temprana edad gracias a sus padres aprendió las técnicas para poder cultivar papa, maíz y frijol ya que en su familia es una vocación. Dilma tiene un grado de educación de primaria completa mismo que pudo terminar gracias al apoyo moral y financiero por sus padres quienes son los únicos involucrados en las diferentes actividades de campo. El terreno que ella trabaja es propio el cual lo adquirió por herencia de sus padres ubicado muy cerca de su casa de habitación aproximadamente 50 metros de distancia al cual se traslada caminando en compañía de sus padres a quienes ella agradece el esfuerzo y apoyo incondicional en todos estos años. Sus clientes son las diferentes personas del mercado local, intermediarios que llegan a la zona entre otros que ayudan al crecimiento de su negocio por medio de la compra de su producto.   
Sus metas, sueños y planes poder darle una excelente educación académica a su hijo para que él tenga mejores oportunidades en su vida, y en la sociedad. Por medio de las ganancias que espera obtener salir de su compromiso para seguir optando por los diferentes beneficios de la cooperativa COMIXMUL y seguir ampliando sus cultivos.
Por los que hoy en día ella ha solicitado financiamiento con el cual podrá comprar insumos agrícolas y semilla de papa de primera calidad para cultivar y dar asistencia a la misma.
texts.en:
Dilma, 22, is a young single mother with a minor child.  She is a homemaker and farmer who, thanks to her parents, learned the technique of growing potatoes, corn and beans because it is a vocation in her family.  Dilma has a full primary education which she was able to finish thanks to the moral and financial support of her parents who are the only ones involved in different farming activities.

She inherited the cropland from her parents and it is about 50 meters from her house.  She walks there with her parents, whom she thanks for their unconditional effort and support every year.  Her customers include the different people at the local market and dealers who visit the area to buy her products, helping to expand her business.

Her goals, dreams and plans are to give her son an excellent academic education so he will have better opportunities than she had in society.  Through the profits she earns she hopes to pay back the loan so she can continue working with the COMIXMUL cooperative and continue increasing her crop business.

The loan she is requesting is to buy farm supplies and quality potato seeds to plant.

loans.use: To buy supplies and quality potato seeds to plant.

loans.name: Agil

texts.en:
Agil is 53 years old and married with four children. His family lives in the Abseron region but they are IDPs (internally displaced persons) from the city of Agdam. His elder son is 25 years old and he helps Agil in his work. His elder daughter is a student who studies at a musical college. Agil’s other children go to school. 

Agil is an electrician. Today he wants to increase his business. Therefore, Agil has applied for a loan in the amount of 1,700 AZN. With this loan he wants to buy construction materials such as chandeliers, wires, etc. Agil is thankful to Kiva lenders for the aid. In the future, he wants to hire an assistant.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
Tha is 26 years old and a woman with a school-going child. Tha runs a small business growing rice and cassava crops in her community, which is located in the Baray district of Kampong Thom. She has been doing this for nearly five years.

As her cassava crops are fully grown, Tha will need to hire laborers to help her harvest her cassavas crops, but she has insufficient money. That’s why she is asking for a loan to hire laborers to help her harvest her cassavas crops. She has been with HKL for one loan already and paid successfully. Tha hopes to sell her cassavas in the local markets at a good price. Her goal is to improve her plantation and to support her family.

loans.use: to hire laborers to help her harvest her cassavas crops.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en: Sammy is a 27-year-old married man who has one child. He describes himself as determined. He operates a garbage collection business where he collects garbage from customers' houses for a fee. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in an area where his potential and primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as non-payment of his collection fees. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase a spacious garbage collection cart. His business goal is to have a garbage collection truck within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will improve his living standards. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase a spacious garbage collection cart.

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es:
Oswaldo tiene 46 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos en el distrito de Santo Tomás, una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus impresionantes paisajes verdes, de un clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura gracias a los diversos pisos ecológicos que posee este distrito, comercio y ganadería a cinco horas de la ciudad de Cutervo, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta y preparación de parihuelas, ceviches, sudados, desde hace un año, tiene clientela considerable por el buen sabor de cada plato que ofrece, también brinda servicio de docencia en el colegio de la zona.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 800 nuevo soles para la compra de insumos en mayor cantidad para mejorar la calidad de sus platos en esta época de las diversas fiestas que se realizan en este distrito y de esta manera atender la demanda de sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Oswaldo, 46, lives with his children in the district of Santo Tomás, a community known for its amazing green landscape, varied climate and people who are involved in agriculture, thanks to the different ecological planes the district has, as well as to commerce and livestock farming.  It is located five hours from the city of Cutervo which belongs to the Cajamarca Region in the northern mountain range of Peru.

He makes and sells fish dishes all year long (parihuelas, ceviches, sudados).  He has a considerable number of customers because of his delicious cooking and he also offers his service to the teaching staff at the local school.

Oswaldo is requesting a loan in the amount of 800 PEN to buy more supplies so he can improve the quality of his food for this holiday season in the district.  It will allow him to attend to customer demand and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: To buy supplies to prepare fish.

loans.name: Maria Doris

texts.es:
María Doris es una joven de 24 años de edad, casada, agricultora y ama de casa, madre de 2 hijos quienes están en la primaria en diferentes grados de educación. Tiene un grado de estudio secundaria el cual curso hasta el tercer año de ciclo común básico gracias al apoyo financiero y moral de sus padres mismos que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra a muy temprana edad siendo su familia agricultora por tradición. En compañía de su esposo se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos como la siembra de maíz, frijol y café siendo su esposo agricultor pero ella también se dedica a otras actividades con las cuales ayuda al fortalecimiento y la economía en su hogar. El terreno que ella trabaja en compañía de su pareja le pertenece a él y está ubicado muy cerca de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan caminando para dar asistencia y mantenimiento.
Sus planes y metas seguir ampliando sus cultivos de café, sembrar una mayor y mejor variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes a quien ella agradece la fidelidad. También seguir fortaleciendo sus cultivos de café para forjar el patrimonio para sus hijos. Para con sus hijos verlos graduados de la universidad, convertidos en excelentes profesionales y en personas de provecho que puedan responder a las necesidades de la vida de manera favorable.
María Doris ha solicitado financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de mangueras, fertilizantes, abono, entre otros que mejoraran la producción de sus cultivos y el rendimiento de los mismos obteniendo al final de la cosecha un excelente grano para su venta.
texts.en:
María Doris, 24, is a young married woman who is a homemaker and farmer.  She has a secondary education thanks to the financial and moral support her parents gave her.  They also taught her to work in agriculture from a very young age since it is family tradition.  Her two children are in primary school.  Along with her husband she grows basic grains such as corn, beans and coffee.  Her husband is a farmer, and she also does other activities to strengthen the household economy.  The cropland belongs to her husband and it is very close to home so they walk there to provide care and maintenance.

Her plans and goals are to continue expanding her coffee crop and plant more and better varieties to thank her customers for their loyalty.  She also wants to strengthen her coffee business for her children's estate.  She wants them to get their university degrees and become excellent professionals.  This is so they can become good people who are able to respond to life's necessities.

María Doris is requesting a loan through the COMIXMUL cooperative to buy hoses, fertilizers and other supplies to improve crop production so she can have an excellent harvest to sell.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies for coffee crop maintenance.

loans.name: Yakeli

texts.es:
Yakeline tiene 19 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en el distrito de Nueva Arica, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a una hora con veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de comida en su restaurante desde hace 2 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su propio domicilio, es conocida por el buen sabor que ofrece en cada platillo.

Es una joven emprendedora ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de insumos arroz, aceite, azúcar entre otros y de esta manera tener a disposición para la preparación de sus platos y al mismo tiempo generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Yakeline is 19 years old and lives with her son in the Nueva Arica district.  The inhabitants of this town, an hour and twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo on Peru's northern coast, make a living in agriculture, running businesses and raising cattle.

Yakeline has been making a living selling meals in a restaurant for two years. She runs the business out of her home and is well-known for the tasty flavours in each of her meals.

Yakeline is an enterprising young woman and has applied for a loan of 1000 Nuevo Soles in order to buy supplies, such as rice, oil, sugar and more, in order to have the necessary items to prepare her meals.  She will also be able to earn more money for her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies, such as rice, oil, sugar and more, in order to prepare meals.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
María Mercedes 61 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún,una comunidad donde su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales patos, cuyes, cerdos, para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, María ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de cerdos y alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y ofrecer a sus clientes a un mejor precio generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
María Mercedes is 61 years old and lives with her husband and children in the Oyotún district. The inhabitants of this town, two hours from the city of Chiclayo on Peru's northern coast, make a living in agriculture, running businesses and raising cattle.

María works raising and selling animals such as ducks, guinea pigs and pigs in order to support her husband with household costs. María has applied for a loan of 1000 Nuevo Soles in order to buy pigs and feed for fattening up her animals. She wants to offer her customers a better price and earn a higher income for her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed to fatten up animals.

loans.name: Jhonny Paul

texts.es:
Jhony Paul tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su madre en el distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la actividad de corte, tintes y ondulaciones de cabello, desde hace más de 10 años, cuenta con clientela considerable y es muy reconocido en la zona por el buen servicio que brinda.

Es un joven emprendedor que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2 000 nuevo soles para la compra de materiales de trabajo tintes y productos de cabello shampoo, cremas de tratamientos capilar entre otros y de esta manera abastecer su salón para ofrecer a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para apoyar a su madre.
texts.en:
Jhony Paul is 36 years old and lives with his mother in the Cayalti district.  The inhabitants of his town, two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on Peru's northern coast, make a living in agriculture, running businesses and raising cattle.

Jhony has been making a living doing cutting, dying and styling hair for over ten years.  He has a good customer base and is very well-known in the area for the good service he provides.

Jhony is an enterprising young man who has a applied for a loan of 2000 Nuevo Soles from "Edpyme Alternativa" in order to buy materials for his work - he will buy dyes, shampoos, hair lotions, and more.  With this loan he can stock up his salon to offer more products to his customers and earning a higher living in order to support his mother.

loans.use: to buy materials, such as dyes and hair treatments, for his work.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos tiene 30 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Buenos Aires una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus bosques de algarrobo, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de pescado desde más de dos años tiene clientela considerable ya que son pocos las personas que ofrecen este producto, adicionalmente vende ropa por pedido, es una mujer emprendedora que se esfuerza en la labor que realiza.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de diversas variedades de pescado para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Santos is 30 years old and lives with her parents in Buenos Aires (Peru), a community known for its carob forests, located by the coast in Northern Peru, two hours away from the city of Piura. Its inhabitants work in agriculture, commerce and livestock.

She has been selling fish for more than two years and has a good customer base, since she has little competition. She also sells clothes on demand. She is an enterprising woman who puts a lot of effort into her job.

Santos has requested a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy different types of fish to sell. This way, she will have a higher income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy different types of fish to sell.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
Clotilde tiene 55 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Zaña, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada cerca al valle del rio Jequetepeque lo que le ha facilitado desarrollarse en la agricultura, a una hora con cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores gallinas, patos y cuyes en la parte posterior a su domicilio, también se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno lechero, desde que se caso para apoyar a su familia con los gastos, tiene una familia unida que se esfuerza en la labor que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Clotilde is 55 years old and lives with her husband in the Zaña district.  The inhabitants of her town make a living in farming, running businesses and raising cattle.  One hour and forty minutes from the city of Chiclayo, on Peru's northern coast, the town's location near the Jequetepeque river makes farming work easier.

Clotilde makes a living raising and selling young animals, such as hens, ducks and guinea pigs, at the back of her house.  She also raises dairy cattle.  Clotilde has been doing this work since she married in order to support her family with household costs.  Clotilde's family is very close and everyone puts in hard-work at their jobs.  Clotilde is applying for a loan of 500 Nuevo Soles in order to buy feed for fattening up her animals.  With this she can earn a higher income for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed to fatten up animals.

loans.name: Adoukoé

texts.fr: Adoukoé vit avec son mari et leurs enfants de 25 et 20ans à Lomé. Elle est revendeuse de produits d'alimentation générale depuis 2004 et exerce son activité à domicile. Manquant de marchandises pour répondre aux besoins des clients, elle fait une demande à WAGES pour acheter plus de tomates, de riz, d'huile végétale... Le gain lui permettra d'assurer le bien être de la famille tout en gardant la pérennité de son activité.
texts.en:
Adoukoé lives with her husband and their children in Lomé.  The children are 20 and 25 years old.  

Adoukoé has sold general food products since 2004, from her home.  Her business suffers from a lack of stock, so, she has requested this loan from the field partner, WAGES, in order to buy products such as tomatoes, rice and vegetable oil.

Adoukoé will use her earnings to ensure that her business can continue, and this will allow her to protect the well being of her family.

loans.use: to buy general food products for resale.

loans.name: Yaba

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits d'alimentation générale, de jus et eau et divers, Yaba fait sa deuxième demande pour acheter plus de marchandises afin de satisfaire la demande de ses clients. Elle souhaite agrandir son activité et assurer le bien être de la famille. Âgée de 44 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants scolarisés.
texts.en:
Yaba sells general food products, fruit juice, water and various other products.  This will be her second loan with the field partner.  She will use her loan to buy more food stocks in order to satisfy the demands of her customers.

Yaba would like to expand her business in order to ensure the well being of her family.

Yaba is 44 years old, married and mother to two children, who both attend school.

loans.use: to buy general food products for resale.

loans.name: Aksante Mungu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bidwaya est une commerçante depuis 10 ans et membre d’une association d’affaires « Aksante Mungu »,  entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 35 ans et mère de 8 enfants dont, 6 étudient et 2 sont encore gamins. Elle est vendeuse des articles divers et sociétaire d’une boutique dans un marché de la place. Elle sollicite un crédit  auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise. Elle commença avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle s’entraide avec son mari pour y parvenir. Elle va acheter 40 litres huiles, 1 sac de farine formant, les allumettes,1 carton de savons, un sac de sucre, des bonbons, biscuits, sel iodé, etc. Dans l’avenir, Elle souhaite accroitre son activité, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique. Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
Bidwaya has been a retailer for 10 years and is a member of the Aksante Mungu business group. She is a dynamic entrepreneur, 35 years old and the mother of 8 children, 6 of whom attend school and 2 of whom are still too young. She sells various items from a shop that she co-owns and which is located in a local market. She is requesting a loan from Hekima in order to increase her business which she started with funds she got from her husband. She and her husband share the financial burdens. She is going to buy items including 40 liters of oil, flour, matches, a box of soap, a bag of sugar, sweets, biscuits and iodized salt. In the coming years, she would like to increase her business, feed her children and make sure they get an education. She thanks Hekima for its support of women entrepreneurs excluded from the classic banking system.

Note: some of the customers in the photo are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to buy items including 40 liters of oil, flour, matches, a box of soap, a bag of sugar, sweets, biscuits and iodized salt.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Badamsambuu

texts.en:
Badamsambuu, 43, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. He has been working as a driver at a private firm since 2010. His wife works as a bookkeeper. Their son also drives a car for a living. 

The house his family lives in has deteriorated and recently he began a renovation but due to a lack of money, he stopped temporarily. Thus he is requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT to buy vacuum insulated windows, hardwood flooring and fiberglass. After the full renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into air. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy insulated windows, hardwood flooring and fiberglass for a home renovation.

loans.name: Kossigan

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 33ans, marié et père de 02 enfants âgées de 5 et 3ans, mr Kossigan pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille, a commencé la vente des CD, des DVD et des boissons dans une baraque. Il se fait aidé par 01 personne et sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter des CD et autres. Il espère investir dans l'activité et bien entretenir sa famille. Kossigan a une ancienneté de 11ans.
texts.en:
Kossigan is a 33-year-old, married, father of two children, aged three and five years old.  In order to support his family, Kossigan sells CDs, DVDs and drinks from a stall, and he has eleven years' experience in his business.  He has one other person who works with him.  

Kossigan has requested this first loan in order to buy CDs and other products for resale.  He will invest in his business and use his earnings to take care of his family.

loans.use: to buy CDs, DVDs and drinks for resale.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Malgré son âge avancé(52ans), Akouvi se bat chaque fois pour apporter le meilleur d'elle - même c'est pour cela qu'en 2011, elle a démarré la vente des chaussures au marché. A l'approche des fêtes de fin d'année, elle fait une première demande à WAGES pour acheter des chaussures afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle espère développer son activité et assurer le bien de ses 03 enfants.
texts.en:
Despite her advancing years (52 years old), Akouvi works hard to always give her best.  To this end, she began selling shoes at the market, in 2011.

As the end of year festivities approach, Akouvi has requested this first loan from the field partner, WAGES.  She will use her loan to buy shoes to satisfy the demands of her customers.

Akouvi would like to expand her business and ensure the well being of her three children.

loans.use: to buy shoes for resale.

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
"My name is Shadrack. I work in the Finance Department for Juhudi Kilimo, an agricultural micro finance institute in Kenya. Previously, I  worked for Turame Community Finance, in Burundi as the Finance and Administrative Director. I have been in the micro finance industry for over 12 years and I like the industry because this is where poverty, food security and health issues are well addressed. 
I am the first born in a family of nine, married and I have three children who are in school. When I finished high school, I started my career in accounting and managed to educate my siblings from the salary. I did so because my mother had minimum resources to educate them. After they all finished high school training, I decided to go back to school to pursue a degree in finance and later pursued my MBA, both of which I financed through bank loans.
I am motivated to do a study related to the factors hindering financing for rural, small-scale farmers. I believe that this study will highlight the gaps in agricultural financing and will give practical recommendations on how financial institutions could provide appropriate financial and nonfinancial services to rural farmers in Kenya. I hope to bring the study results back to Juhudi and align it with the business growth strategy for the next four to five years. I also hope to be able to share the findings of my research with other Kiva partners in order to improve the financial product design at other MFIs to benefit loan recipients in the region. "

loans.use: To pay for a PhD in business administration and management with a concentration in entrepreneurship at the Kenya Methodist University.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
"My name is Nancy, the Chief Human Resource Manager at Juhudi Kilimo, an agricultural microfinance institution in Kenya. I am requesting a loan on Kiva to pursue my Masters in Business Administration. The reason I am seeking a loan to finance my MBA is because I am the sole bread winner in my family following an accident that rendered my husband jobless in 2010. I have two teenagers who are in high school and therefore my income is stretched managing the family affairs.

After high school, I worked for 4 years as a secretary but I felt I had capacity to do more. I developed a strong liking for the HR profession working as a Personal Assistant to an HR and Admin Manager, and it is then I decided to enroll for a diploma in Leadership and Management. I got a diploma in Leadership and Management and from there on my career in HR started. I grew within the ranks of HR profession from a Personal Assistant, HR Assisant, to HR Officer. To move from the position of a HR Officer required a degree and I enrolled for a Bachelor of Science in Leadership and Management where I got first class honors. I was promoted to the position of a Senior HR and Training Officer in 2009.

I joined Juhudi Kilimo in mid 2012 as a Human Resource Manager and what really attracted me to Juhudi is their core business of financing rural farmers. Having worked in a pure for profit organization and in particular healthcare, my desire was to join a social enterprise that would focus on the development of our customers in a sustainable manner. I fell in love with Juhudi's mission, their client focus and the impact they were creating in the society. I was also excited to join Juhudi because they did not have a HR function and they wanted me to set it up and this was a great opportunity for me to put in to practice my years of experience as a HR.

Juhudi is at a point in time that it requires a strong and very skilled leadership team who will be able to deliver on our promises to our farmers. As an executive heading the HR function, I will benefit greatly from the Masters in Business Administration from USIU which will give me hands on experience in functional areas related to HR like Finance, Marketing, Strategy and Entrepreneurship. I choose the Global Executive MBA from USIU as it focuses on managers who hold senior positions and the approach is very hands-on and work based. I am therefore able to transfer the newly acquired skills and knowledge into my day to day activities, creating a greater impact that Juhudi will need in the next 3 years as it scales up."

loans.use: to pay for a Masters in Business Administration at the United States International University in Nairobi, Kenya.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is an experienced farmer from Chiva village in the Vayots Dzor region. He lives with his wife, son, and school-age daughter. Armen's wife works in the village school. Unfortunately, her salary is so low it is impossible to meet the very basic needs of the family. 

To take care of the family's needs Armen is extensively engaged in agribusiness; he breeds cattle, sheep, and hens, and cultivates peaches, apricots, apples, pears, and walnuts. With the help of his son he sells the products in the local market, which is an important source of income. Breeding sheep is the most essential component of Armen's business; he currently wants to expand it a little bit. 

To reach that goal, he needs a loan of $3,000 to purchase 30 sheep. As this is Armen’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Armen and his family will be very thankful to the lenders for their good will and support.

loans.use: to purchase 30 sheep.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio es un campesino que ha trabajado en la producción de café desde hace 25 años. El vive con su esposa y su hijo. Antonio esta en el proceso de conversión de café convencional a café orgánico, para fortalecer este proceso necesita comprar una pica todo, una guadaña y una estacionaria, herramientas que le ayudaran a mejorar las actividades en su finca aumentando la producción y la calidad del café, esta inversión le costara 4.000.000  millones de pesos. Sus metas a largo plazo es lograr el manejo de una finca orgánica integral implementando especies menores y mayores para la producción de abonos orgánicos y mejorar la alimentación de su familia, también sueña en certificarse como un productor orgánico en FCC por que esta convencido de que una agricultura limpia y saludable vale la pena, a nivel familiar Antonio quiere seguir capacitándose en temas orgánicos y apoyar a su hijo para que estudie una carrera que permita mejorar y tecnificar los procesos en finca.


La  conversión y producción de café orgánico es un proceso integral al largo plazo independiente, saludable, balanceado y amigable con el medio ambiente lo que  representa un desafío para los campesinos de Colombia y Antonio  ha decidido no arriesgar su salud; la de su familia ni la de los consumidores, al seguir usando químicos. La FCC están convencida que vale la pena apoyar y fortalecer estas iniciativas alternas. Un préstamo con Kiva representa un futuro sostenible por su producción, su tierra, y su familia.
texts.en:
Antonio is a farmer who has been in the business of growing coffee for 25 years. He lives with his wife and son. Antonio is in the process of converting from conventional to organic coffee farming. To reinforce this process, he needs to buy a grinder, a scythe, and stationary equipment, tools that will help him to improve work on his farm, and increase both his production and the quality of his coffee. This investment will cost him 4,000,000 pesos. 

His long-term goal is to become a complete, fully organic farm, with both major and minor species to make organic fertilizers and improve the nutrition of his family. He also dreams of being certified as an organic grower by the FCC (Federación Campesina del Cauca, or Cauca Farmer's Association).  He is convinced that clean and healthy farming is worth the trouble. On a family level, Antonio wants to keep training himself on organic farming and support his son as he studies for a career that will help bring technology to the farm and improve its processes.

The conversion and production of organic coffee is a key process toward a long-term that is independent, healthy, balanced, and friendly with respect to the environment. This represents a challenge for the farmers of Colombia, and Antonio has decided not to risk his health, his family's, or his consumers' by continuing to use chemicals. The FCC is convinced that it's worthwhile to support and strengthen these alternative initiatives.  A loan from Kiva represents a sustainable future for his production, his land, and his family.

loans.use: switch over to organic coffee farming.

loans.name: Samra

texts.en:
Samra is a 22-year-old woman who is living in Lahore, Pakistan. The financial condition of her family is not good; her husband is a tailor by profession and his work mostly consists of festivals. 

Her husband conducted a tailoring business in which he provides the service of sewing clothes to his customers. He is very expert in his profession and people like his stitched clothes a lot. He has to pay the rent on a shop on a monthly basis, so this is the reason he decided to buy a shop of his own. However due to a lack of availability of funds, Samra requested a loan for her husband so he can buy a tiny shop to continue his business.

Samra is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a shop for tailoring business

loans.name: Ararati Group

texts.fr: La cliente Sawasawa est une commerçante, présidente et membre d’un collectif d’affaires « Ararati »,   entrepreneur, âgée de 35 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants qui tous, étudient. La cliente est une vendeuse des divers matériels domestiques usagers. Elle étale sa marchandise sur la route principale de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu comme prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Son conjoint est un pasteur dans une Eglise locale. Il y a 2 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 2 résistances de chauffage, 2 casseroles, 5 gobelets  métalliques. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son activité, scolariser, vêtir, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique poste conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en: Sawasawa, the customer, is a retailer and the leader of the Ararati business group. She is a 35-year-old entrepreneur who is married and the mother of 5 children who are all studying. Sawasawa sells various household items. She displays her merchandise along the side of the main road in town. She started her business with funds she received from Hekima in the form of a loan. She has been in this line of work for 2 years. Her spouse is the pastor of a local church. This new loan will be used to buy 2 heaters, 2 pans and 5 metal cups. She hopes to increase her business, clothe and feed her children and ensure that they get an education. She strongly thanks Hekima for its help in making non-bankable female entrepreneurs self-sufficient, especially in this critical time of war in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 2 heaters, 2 pans and 5 metal cups.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Musingi Bora Group

texts.fr: La cliente M’Mugorozi est une commerçante et membre de l’association d’affaires « Musingi Bora », senior  entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 54 ans et mère de 6 enfants qui, 2 étudient encore. La cliente est une vendeuse de viande. Elle installe ses marchandises dans une maison (Boucherie) sur les artères animées de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance de son mari. Son conjoint est un Ingénieur. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 22 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 50 kg de viande. Ainsi, elle souhaite devenir grossiste, construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment difficile poste conflit dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en: M’Mugorozi, the customer, is a retailer and a member of the Musingi Bora business group. She is an experienced and dynamic entrepreneur who is 54 years old and the mother of 6 children, 2 of whom are still at school. M’Mugorozi sells meat. She displays her merchandise in a butcher shop located one of the town's busy main roads. She started her business with her husband's help. Her spouse is an engineer. Later on, she benefited from a loan from the MFI Hekima. She has been in this line of work for 22 years. This new loan will be used to buy 50 kilos of meat. She wants to become a wholesaler, to build a house and to feed her children and ensure that they get an education. Finally, she strongly thanks Hekima for its help in making non-bankable female entrepreneurs self-sufficient, especially during this difficult time of war in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 50 kilos of meat.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en:
Ruslan is a freshman in the Software Engineering Program. This is his story:

I have chosen to become a programmer. Ever since I was a child, I have taken a deep interest in computers and electronics. I not only like to play computer games, I am also very curious about the process of game and program development. This was one of the reasons my parents sent me to the physics and mathematics lyceum #61, where I studied from the 1st grade. While studying at school, I attended a programming course at Tomsk State University of Control Systems and Radio Electronics. I also studied the basics of such programming languages as Visual Basic, С++, Turbo Pascal and Delphi. For further motivation, I participated in a number of competitions (Olympiads) in mathematics and informatics: the Lomonosov Olympiad, as well as School and City Olympiads on informatics. In 2013, I took third place in the AUCA informatics competition, which gave me a partial scholarship.

Aside from programming, I like to read sci-fi books, play chess, and devote my free time to physical activities, such as practicing aikido, wushu, and football. When it came to choosing a university, I knew that the AUCA was exactly what I needed. Not only because it is the best and most prestigious university in Kyrgyzstan, but also because it provides opportunities for all-around development of an individual and improvement of leadership skills through a number of intellectual contests and cultural events. This allows young people to become more communicative and self-confident, which is very important for better social integration and competitiveness on the labor market.

loans.use: to pay for higher education.

loans.name: Bennette

texts.en:
Bennette is a 26-year-old married woman with 5 children. 

She has a small plantation and grows tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbages, eggplant, etc., to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. Bennette has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a shovel, bush-knives, a backpack sprayer and a wheelbarrow.
